Food.name: อาหาร
Food.desc: [Food] is necessary to feed your clan. Stock up on food before winter. Avoid starvation at all costs.

Wood.name: ไม้
Wood.desc: [Wood]ใช้ในการสร้างอาคารและเป็น ไม้ฟืน โดยเฉพาะในช่วงฤดูหนาว

Money.name: Kröwns
Money.desc: [Money]ใช้เพื่อรับสมัครนักรบของคุณและสำหรับค่าบำรุงรักษาอาคาร

Happy.name: ความสุข
Happy.desc: [Happy] จะดึงดูดชาวบ้านใหม่มาที่ศาลากลางของคุณ เพิ่มความสุขของคุณเพื่อเร่งกระบวนการนี้

Warband.name: กลุ่มนักรบ

Lore.name: ตำนาน
Lore.desc: [Lore]ที่ค้นพบใน Northgard จะช่วยให้คุณ สามารถเพิ่มความรู้ของเผ่าได้

Fame.name: ชื่อเสียง
Fame.desc: เพิ่ม [Fame] ของคุณและได้รับการประกาศเป็นราชาแห่งนอร์ธการ์ด!

Sailors.name: กะลาสีเรือ

Forge.name: โรงฅีเหล็ก

Stone.name: หิน
Stone.desc: [Stone] สามารถใช้เพื่ออัพเกรดสิ่งปลูกสร้างเผ่าของคุณ

Iron.name: เหล็ก
Iron.desc: [Iron]ใช้เพื่อสร้างอาวุธที่ทรงพลังและสร้างเครื่องมือที่ดีขึ้น

Prestige.name: อิทธิพลทางการค้า
Prestige.desc: [Prestige] can be earned by exploiting Great Trade Routes via a [Lighthouse].

RimeSteel.name: Rimesteel
RimeSteel.desc: [RimeSteel] ใช้ในการสร้าง Wurmslayer อันยิ่งใหญ่

Gemstone.name: พลอย
Gemstone.desc: [Gemstone] เป็นทรัพยากรอันมีค่าที่พ่อค้าในต่างแดนต้องการ

MilitaryXP.name: ประสบการณ์ทางทหาร
MilitaryXP.desc: You earn [MilitaryXP] by killing enemy units or losing your own in battle.

HuntTrophy.name: Hunting Trophy
HuntTrophy.desc: You earn [HuntTrophy]s by killing animals and their mythical counterparts.

Villager.name: ชาวบ้าน
Villager.desc: ชาวบ้านจะรวบรวม [Food] ในป่า, ตุนเพื่อให้เผ่าของคุณไม่อดอยากในช่วงฤดูหนาว
Villager.flavor: พร้อมที่จะทำงาน!

Woodcutter.name: คนตัดไม้
Woodcutter.desc: ผู้เชี่ยวชาญในการเก็บเกี่ยว [Wood], คนตัดไม้จำเป็นต่อการปรับปรุงการตั้งถิ่นฐานของเผ่าคุณ

Farmer.name: เกษตรกร
Farmer.desc: มีประสบการณ์ในการปลูกพืช, เกษตรกรจะผลิต [Food] ในปริมาณที่มากขึ้นในช่วงฤดูร้อน

Hunter.name: นักล่าสัตว์
Hunter.langs.plural: นักล่าสัตว์
Hunter.desc: นักล่าที่มีทักษะจะติดตามและฆ่ากวางเพื่อจัดหา [Meat] ให้กับเผ่าของคุณ

Fisherman.name: ชาวประมง
Fisherman.desc: ชาวประมงจะจัดหา [Fish] สำหรับเผ่าของคุณ, การผลิตของพวกเขาไม่ได้รับผลกระทบจากฤดูหนาว

Merchant.name: พ่อค้า
Merchant.desc: การบำรุงรักษาอาคารและการสรรหากลุ่มนักรบมีค่าใช้จ่าย [Money], พ่อค้าจะสร้างรายได้ที่มั่นคงให้กับเผ่าของคุณ

Sailor.name: กะลาสี
Sailor.desc: กะลาสีเรือจะบุกโจมตีชายฝั่งใกล้ๆและนำ [Money] และ [Fame] หรือ [Lore] มาที่เผ่าของคุณ
Sailor.props.noFameDesc: กะลาสีเรือจะบุกโจมตีชายฝั่งใกล้ๆและนำ [Money] และ [Lore] มาที่เผ่าของคุณ

RuneMaster.name: ปรมาจารย์
RuneMaster.desc: จ้าวแห่งตำนาน [Lore], พวกเขาสามารถศึกษาเพชรพลอยเพิ่มพูนความรู้ของคุณ
RuneMaster.flavor: โดยทั่วไปแล้วพวกไวกิ้งช่างเนิร์ด

InnKeeper.name: คนต้มเบียร์
InnKeeper.langs.plural: คนต้มเบียร์
InnKeeper.desc: คนต้มเบียร์จะสำรองเบียร์ในคลังเสบียงส่งผลให้ค่า [Happy] เพิ่มให้กับเผ่าของคุณ

Skald.name: Skald
Skald.desc: Skalds' tales of your clan's deeds will increase your [Fame] and [Happy].
Skald.flavor: "Skald" literally means "poet." Skaldic poetry is one of the two main forms of Old Norse poetry, the other being Eddic poetry.

Miner.name: คนขุดแร่
Miner.desc: Miners extract [Stone] and [Iron] from the area until the deposits are depleted.

Scout.name: Scout
Scout.desc: Scouts explore new areas, allowing you to expand your territory. They can also explore Ruins and Shipwrecks.

Healer.name: Healer
Healer.desc: Healers gather medicinal herbs that your wounded will use to heal themselves. The wounded must be within your territory to heal. They also gather [Food] when not otherwise busy.

Mender.name: Mender
Mender.desc: Menders heal wounded Vikings within your territory and gather [Lore] when not otherwise busy.

Smith.name: ช่างตีเหล็ก
Smith.langs.plural: ช่างตีเหล็ก
Smith.desc: Smiths can forge improved tools or weapons, powerful relics and the legendary Sword of Odin.

Scholar.name: Herald
Scholar.desc: Heralds study politics, legends, and epic stories. They also like to alter a lot of it.

Slave.name: ข้ารับใช้
Slave.desc:
[Slave]s do not count towards your population and do not require housing.
They also consume less [Food] and [Wood] and are less efficient when gathering resources.
You can buy more [Slave]s from your [Port].

Norn.name: Norn
Norn.desc: The Norns try to elucidate the will of the Kraken, bringing foresight and good fortune to the clan.

Warrior.name: นักรบ
Warrior.desc: นักรบเป็นยูนิตพื้นฐานที่สุดใน [Warband] . พวกเขามีความเชี่ยวชาญในการสู้รบและได้เปรียบกับคู่ต่อสู้ที่ใช้โล่ป้องกัน
Warrior.flavor: Fun fact: Viking warriors did not wear horned helmets. This depiction originates from the 1876 rendition of Wagner's Der Ring des Nibelungen.

ShieldBearer.name: พลทหารโล่
ShieldBearer.desc: พลทหารโล่เป็นหน่วยที่มีพลังป้องกันสูง และรับค่าความเสียหายน้อยลงเมื่อถูกโจมตีจากระยะไกล

AxeWielder.name: นักปาขวาน
AxeWielder.desc: นักปาขวานสามารถโจมตีระยะไกลได้ และมีพลังโจมตีที่มากกว่าทหารทั่วไป แต่จะมีค่าพลังชีวิตที่น้อยกว่า

Skirmisher.name: นักต่อสู้
Skirmisher.desc: นักต่อสู้เปรียบเสมือนพลทหารเบาที่นำค่าพลังป้องกันแลกกับการการเคลื่อนไหวที่รวดเร็วขึ้น นอกจากนั้นยังสามารถ [CanHide].
Skirmisher.flavor: อย่าปล่อยให้คาดสายตาเราไป เพราะบางทีมันอาจจะสายเกินไปแล้ว

Dragonmen.name: นักรบมังกร
Dragonmen.langs.plural: นักรบมังกร
Dragonmen.desc: การเรียกพวกเขาได้จะต้องผ่านการบูชายัญ [Dragonmen] จะสู้รบกับเราไปตลอดกาล

Mercenary.name: ทหารรับจ้าง
Mercenary.langs.plural: ทหารรับจ้าง
Mercenary.desc: จ้างพวกเขาด้วย [Money] ทหารรับจ้างเชื่อถือไม่ได้เสมอไป แต่พวกเขาจะออกปล้น และก่อความวุ่นวายให้กับเหยื่อของพวกเขาแน่นอน

Militia.name: ทหารชาวบ้าน
Militia.desc: ชาวบ้านติดเกราะและอาวุธ พวกเขามีประสิทธิภาพไม่ด้อยไปกว่านักรบทั่วไปเลย

Bodyguard.name: ผู้ปกป้อง
Bodyguard.desc: ผู้ปกป้องจะสู้เคียงบ่าเคียงไหล่แม่ทัพ และแม่ทัพเองจะได้รับโบนัสค่าพลังโจมตีและป้องกันเพิ่มขึ้นอีกด้วย
Bodyguard.flavor: เจ้าต้องข้ามศพข้าไปให้ได้ซะก่อน!

Tracker.name: นักล่า
Tracker.desc: นักล่ามีความเชี่ยวชาญในการโจมตีระยะไกลเป็นอย่างมาก แต่จะอ่อนแอลงเมื่อต้องต่อสู้ระยะประชิด
Tracker.flavor: นักล่าไม่ใช่พรานนะจ้ะ

Hero01.name: แม่ทัพ
Hero01.desc: แม่ทัพเป็นผู้นำเผ่าที่มีประสบการณ์และความเชี่ยวชาญในการต่อสู้เป็นอย่างมาก
Hero01.editor.name: แม่ทัพ [Goat]

Hero02.name: แม่ทัพ
Hero02.desc: แม่ทัพเป็นผู้นำเผ่าที่มีประสบการณ์และความเชี่ยวชาญในการต่อสู้เป็นอย่างมาก
Hero02.editor.name: แม่ทัพ [Raven]

Hero03.name: แม่ทัพ
Hero03.desc: แม่ทัพเป็นผู้นำเผ่าที่มีประสบการณ์และความเชี่ยวชาญในการต่อสู้เป็นอย่างมาก
Hero03.editor.name: แม่ทัพ [Stag]

Hero04.name: แม่ทัพ
Hero04.desc: แม่ทัพเป็นผู้นำเผ่าที่มีประสบการณ์และความเชี่ยวชาญในการต่อสู้เป็นอย่างมาก
Hero04.editor.name: แม่ทัพ [Boar]

Berserker.name: Berserker
Berserker.desc: A powerful and reckless warrior, feared by all enemies of the Wolf Clan.
Berserker.editor.name: แม่ทัพ [Wolf]

Maiden.name: Shield Maiden
Maiden.desc: Stalwart defender of her people, she is the reason the Bear Clan will never falter.
Maiden.editor.name: Warchief [Bear]

WarchiefSnake.name: Signy
WarchiefSnake.desc: A shadowy leader with no regard for morals, Signy will stop at nothing to make a mark on Northgard.
WarchiefSnake.flavor: The Snake will soon sink its fangs in Northgard!
WarchiefSnake.editor.name: Warchief [Snake]

WarchiefDragon.name: Warchief
WarchiefDragon.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
WarchiefDragon.editor.name: Warchief [Dragon]

HorseMaiden.name: Eitria
HorseMaiden.desc: A gifted artisan, Eitria focuses more on clan leadership and only picks up the pickaxe to let off steam.
HorseMaiden.editor.name: Warchief [Horse]

HorseHero.name: Brok
HorseHero.desc: Strong and wise, Brok is happy to focus on his craft and leave politics to his sister.
HorseHero.editor.name: Warchief [Horse]

KrakenMaiden.name: Warchief
KrakenMaiden.desc: Warchiefs are experienced units that bring their strength and leadership to bear in combat.
KrakenMaiden.editor.name: Warchief [Kraken]

OxHero.name: Torfin
OxHero.desc: Head of the clan of the Ox, [OxHero] is a Hero both feared and respected by all across Northgard.
OxHero.editor.name: Warchief [Ox]

LynxHero.name: Mielikki
LynxHero.desc: Fierce huntress in her youth, Mielikki is known as the Beastmaster. She now rules on Northgard wildlife as she sees through [LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite]’s eyes.
LynxHero.editor.name: Warchief [Lynx]

Berserker03.name: Egil
Berserker03.desc: A ruthless and impetuous young berserker, Egil, bannerman of the Wolf Clan, is in it mostly for the mayhem.
Berserker03.editor.name: Bannerman [Wolf]

Maiden02.name: Borgild
Maiden02.desc: Brave and arrogant, Borgild, bannermaiden of the Bear Clan, is a tough woman who bows to no one and shows little mercy for the weakhearted.
Maiden02.editor.name: Bannerman [Bear]

Maiden03.name: Liv
Maiden03.desc: Ambitious and pragmatic, Liv, the cunning bannermaiden of the Raven Clan, likes to control every parameter of a situation and hates wasting time or Kröwns on futile pursuits.
Maiden03.flavor: The end always justifies the means.
Maiden03.editor.name: Bannerman [Raven]

Hero06.name: Halvard
Hero06.desc: Halvard, the elderly bannerman of the Goat Clan, is a wise and kind-hearted man focused on the survival of his people.
Hero06.editor.name: Bannerman [Goat]

Hero07.name: Brand
Hero07.desc: Proud and noble at heart, Brand, bannerman of the Stag Clan, is a loyal man who lives and fights with honor.
Hero07.flavor: May our victories be sung for centuries!
Hero07.editor.name: Bannerman [Stag]

Hero08.name: Svarn
Hero08.desc: The taciturn Svarn, spiritual leader of the Boar Clan rebels, is both a sage and a warrior who lives a simple life, close to Nature and in accordance with the Old Ways.
Hero08.flavor: I can... FEEL your presence. Yes... YOURS.
Hero08.editor.name: Bannerman [Boar]

NornArmor.name: Valkyrie
NornArmor.desc: Wielding divine power, the Valkyries are the most powerful members of the Kraken's army.

GiantHero.name: Bláinn
GiantHero.desc: Bláinn is a legendary [Giant] who decided to befriend humans and lend them his unrivaled strength.

Hero05.name: Hagen
Hero05.desc: The shady leader of the Raven Clan and murderer of your father. Although fierce and merciless, he tends to act cowardly when things turn sour.
Hero05.flavor: Fight for me and ye'll be rich!
Hero05.editor.name: Campaign Warchief

Berserker02.name: Hvedrung
Berserker02.desc: The mysterious leader of the Boar Clan, hellbent on bringing about Ragnarök. His actions were somehow foretold by the Runes. Some believe he is not a mere mortal.
Berserker02.flavor: I shall be "the villain" if it makes things more comprehensible for your feeble mind. And yes: I know you are reading this.
Berserker02.editor.name: Campaign Final Warchief

LichKing.name: Valdemar The Cursed
LichKing.desc: Valdemar is a powerful dead warchief. He can't be hit if there is [IceGolem] with him.
LichKing.flavor: Valdemar was a legendary king who died bringing battle to Helheim. Or so we thought...
LichKing.editor.name: Conquest Warchief

Death.name: Draugr
Death.desc: Draugar are half-dead evil creatures that have infested the islands of Northgard.
Death.flavor: Only the most nefarious and greediest human beings turn into Draugar when they die.

Giant.name: Jötunn
Giant.desc: Ancient creatures from the Dark Ages, [Giant]s are peaceful until you attack them. If you do, brace yourself!
Giant.flavor: Ymir, the primitive giant, is said to be the father of all giants and dwarves.

UndeadGiant.name: Draugr Jötunn
UndeadGiant.desc: Jötnar aren't immune to becoming Draugar.
UndeadGiant.flavor: Your undead problems are now available in extra-large.

GiantFire.name: Eldthurs
GiantFire.desc: The "sons of Muspell" are hellbent on destroying the world. They will wreak as much havoc as they can before burning away, as they can't survive outside of their homeworld.

GiantCrow.name: Son of Hrymr
GiantCrow.desc: They sometimes attack with their two huge warhammers, damaging all nearby enemies.
GiantCrow.flavor: Chosing the smallest giants as mercenaries is important if you want your ships to stay afloat.

Myrkalfar.name: Myrkálf
Myrkalfar.desc: The [Myrkalfar]s are an agressive and cunning native faction. Never trust them, and watch their moves carefully. Don't let them enter your territory, otherwise they will steal resources from you.

Kobold.name: Kobold
Kobold.desc: [Kobold]s can be a great trade partner, but also an annoyance when they take valuable land.

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.desc: Vicious giant wolves roam the lands of Northgard. They will not hesitate to attack humans.

WhiteWolf.name: White Wolf
WhiteWolf.desc: White wolves are more powerful than standard wolves. They also have the ability [CanHide]
WhiteWolf.flavor: Avatars of the Wargs, they look for pieces of the sun and the moon lost in the world.

SacredWolf.name: Mythical Wolf
SacredWolf.desc: Mythical Wolves are the most dangerous of their kind. Beware of their [FerociousBite].

SpectralWolf.name: Wolf Spirit
SpectralWolf.desc: The spirit of a Mythical Wolf comes back to unleash his rage one more time.

Bear.name: Brown Bear
Bear.desc: Solitary creatures that fiercely defend their territory. They'll prove challenging to even the most seasoned warriors.

WhiteBear.name: Bear
WhiteBear.desc: Solitary creatures that fiercely defend their territory. They'll prove challenging to even the most seasoned warriors.

SacredBear.name: Mythical Bear
SacredBear.desc: Mythical Bears' massive paws will make the earth tremble in their path.

SpectralBear.name: Bear Spirit
SpectralBear.desc: The spirit of a Mythical Bear comes back to unleash his rage one more time.

BearMaiden.name: Kaija, the Armored Bear
BearMaiden.desc: Kaija is a powerful defensive unit that cannot enter enemy territory, unless you have unlocked [BearAwake].

SacredRam.name: Mythical Ram
SacredRam.desc: Fathers of Northgard sheeps, Mythical Rams will protect them at all cost.

SpectralRam.name: Ram Spirit
SpectralRam.desc: The spirit of a Mythical Ram comes back to unleash his rage one more time.

LynxBrown.name: Brundr
LynxBrown.desc: [LynxBrown] is the youngest, playful brother. He may look like an innocent cat, but his scratches are no joke.

LynxWhite.name: Kaelinn
LynxWhite.desc: [LynxWhite] seeks to protect his young brother from Northgard's cruel foes. They fear his roar accross all lands.
LynxWhite.flavor: Is that a firefly, in the bush? Aaargh!

Wyvern.name: Wyvern
Wyvern.desc: The most fearsome of the ancient creatures roaming the lands of Northgard.

WyvernUndead.name: Undead Wyvern
WyvernUndead.desc: The most fearsome of the ancient creatures roaming the lands of Northgard.

Valkyrie.name: Fallen Valkyrie
Valkyrie.desc: Originally champions of the gods, some Valkyries have been corrupted by the powers of Helheim.
Valkyrie.flavor: "Valkyrie" means "chooser of the slain," as they decide which fallen warriors will join Odin in Valhöll.

SpecterWarrior.name: Spectral Warrior
SpecterWarrior.desc: These undead Vikings are dangerous foes whose mere presence within your borders will reduce your clan's [Happy]. Projectiles have ::percent:: chances of missing them.
SpecterWarrior.flavor: An intricate Seidr burial ritual can bring back the soul of a warrior who didn't die in battle, so that they can fight for glory one last time and find peace.

IceWorm.name: Hrímgandr
IceWorm.desc: A giant, near-invincible rime serpent living mostly underground. Only the Wurmslayer can make a dent in its diamond-hard icy scales.
IceWorm.flavor: Said to be the spawn of Jörmungandr, imbued with Niflheim's fumes.

Golem.name: Rock Golem
Golem.desc: [Golem]s are powerful creatures that can burn their foes with molten lava.

IceGolem.name: Dark Vaettir
IceGolem.desc: Unholy ice spirits that should not live on this side of Bifrost.

GiantBoar.name: Giant Boar
GiantBoar.desc: Agressive if summoned in neutral or enemy territory. Friendly if summoned in allied territory. You can sacrifice it to earn [Food]. Giant Boars regenerate their health quickly.
GiantBoar.flavor: The legend say that Gullinbursti can be eaten each day, because it regenerate itself every day.

ColossalBoar.name: Colossal Boar
ColossalBoar.desc: This majestic creature is the ideal hunting trophy to bring back home. His health still regenerate as quickly as any Giant Boar.
ColossalBoar.flavor: The legend say that Gullinbursti can be eaten each day, because it regenerate itself every day.

Sheep.name: Sheep
Sheep.desc: Having at least one Sheep in an area reduces the need for Firewood by ::percent:: during winter for this area.
Sheep.flavor: Clicking this Sheep repeatedly is guaranteed to be 100% safe.

Vedrfolnir.name: Vedrfolnir
Vedrfolnir.desc: Vedrfolnir has been hurt. Once healed, he will scout certain areas for your clan. You will also gain 100 [Lore].
Vedrfolnir.flavor: Vedrfolnir is a hawk usually sitting between the eyes of the giant eagle perched atop Yggdrasil.

Group.name: Group
Group.desc: Click to select a specific job among the group:

House.name: House
House.desc: Provides shelter for more clan members.
House.upgrades: <0> Can shelter ::value:: additional clan members and improve housing quality. </0>

ScoutCamp.name: Scout Camp
ScoutCamp.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Scout]s who can explore new areas.
ScoutCamp.flavor: Empty for the greater part of the year.
ScoutCamp.upgrades: <0> Increases all your [Scout]s' scouting speed by ::percent::. They also can go to enemy territories. </0>

WoodLodge.name: Woodcutter's Lodge
WoodLodge.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Woodcutter]s who can harvest Wood in this area.

HealerHut.name: Healer's Hut
HealerHut.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Healer]s who will heal your wounded or sick clan members in your territory. They gather [Food] while not healing.

MenderHut.name: Mender's Hut
MenderHut.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Mender]s who will heal your wounded clan members in your territory and gather [Lore] when not otherwise busy.

FishermanHouse.name: Fisherman's Hut
FishermanHouse.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Fisherman]s who will produce [Food] even during winter.

Fishery.name: Fishery
Fishery.desc: Assign your villagers to become a [Fisherman]s who will produce [Food].

Fields.name: Fields
Fields.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Farmer]s who will produce [Food] in larger quantities during summer.

HunterLodge.name: Hunter's Lodge
HunterLodge.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Hunter]s who will track and kill deer.

FoodSilo.name: คลังอาหาร
FoodSilo.desc: Improves [Food] produced by specialized workers in this area by ::percent::. Increases your maximum food storage.
FoodSilo.upgrades: <0> Improves [Food] produced in this area by ::percent::. </0>

TradingPost.name: Trading Post
TradingPost.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Merchant]s who will earn [Money]s.

MarketPlace.name: Marketplace
MarketPlace.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Merchant]s and spend [Money] to buy various resources.

RavenPort.name: Harbor
RavenPort.desc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] or [Fame] while raiding. You can scout shores and hire [Mercenary]s. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

Port.name: Longship Dock
Port.desc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] or [Fame] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.
Port.props.noFameDesc: Sailors loot [Money] and [Lore] while raiding. Add a [Lighthouse] to exploit Great Trade Routes.

HallOfPoetry.name: Hall of Skalds
HallOfPoetry.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Skald]s who will increase your clan's [Fame] and [Happy].

Horgr.name: Hörgr
Horgr.desc: Assign your female [VillagerWoman]s to become [Norn]s. They will increase your clan's [Happy] and your [Prescience].

Tavern.name: Brewery
Tavern.desc: Assign your villagers to become [InnKeeper]s who will increase your clan's [Happy].

AllMines.name: Mine
AllMines.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Miner]s to extract [Stone], [Iron], [RimeSteel] or [Gemstone] ores from deposits.

Mine.name: Quarry
Mine.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Miner]s who will quarry [Stone].

IronMine.name: Iron Mine
IronMine.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Miner]s who will extract [Iron] ore.

RimeSteelMine.name: Rimesteel Mine
RimeSteelMine.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Miner]s who will extract [RimeSteel] ore.

GemStonesMine.name: Gemstone Mine
GemStonesMine.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Miner]s who will extract [Gemstone] ore.

Forge.name: Forge
Forge.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Smith]s. Allows you to forge better tools, weapons and legendary relics.
Forge.upgrades: <0> Increases forge speed by ::percent:: in the zone. </0>

ForgeHorse.name: Völund's Forge
ForgeHorse.desc: Allows you to forge better tools, weapons and legendary relics with your warchiefs.
ForgeHorse.upgrades: <0> Increases forge speed by ::percent:: in the zone. </0>

CarvedStone.name: Carved Stone
CarvedStone.desc: Assign a villager to become a [RuneMaster] who will produce [Lore].
CarvedStone.flavor: Quite a bit heavier than a book.

Sheepfold.name: Sheepfold
Sheepfold.desc: Allows you to enclose your [Sheep] to produce [Food].
Sheepfold.flavor: Better than slaughtering the poor things, right?
Sheepfold.upgrades: <0> Allows you to assign one more [Sheep]. They produce ::percent:: more [Food]. </0>

TrainingCamp.name: Training Camp
TrainingCamp.desc: Allows you to recruit military units and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
TrainingCamp.upgrades: <0> Increases your [Warrior]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. You also gain +::value::[Warband]. </0>

SkirmishCenter.name: Skirmisher Camp
SkirmishCenter.desc: Allows you to recruit [Skirmisher]s and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
SkirmishCenter.upgrades: <0> Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Skirmisher]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. </0>

AxeCenter.name: Axe Thrower Camp
AxeCenter.desc: Allows you to recruit [AxeWielder]s, powerful ranged units, and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
AxeCenter.upgrades: <0> Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [AxeWielder]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. </0>

ShieldCenter.name: Shield Bearer Camp
ShieldCenter.desc: Allows you to recruit [ShieldBearer]s, which are well protected against ranged units and towers, and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
ShieldCenter.upgrades: <0> Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [ShieldBearer]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. </0>

Archery.name: Archery Range
Archery.desc: Allows you to recruit [Tracker]s, choose their arrows, and increases your [Warband] size by ::value::.
Archery.upgrades: <0> Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Tracker]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. </0>

DragonmenCamp.name: Dragonkin Altar
DragonmenCamp.desc: Permanently transforms your villagers into [Dragonmen]s by following forgotten rituals and increases your [Warband]s size by ::value::.
DragonmenCamp.upgrades: <0> Gain +::value::[Warband] and increase your [Dragonmen]s' attack by ::percent_value1::. </0>

WatchTower.name: Defense Tower
WatchTower.desc: Protects this area from enemies by shooting at them.
WatchTower.upgrades: <0> Increases the tower's attack and resistance by ::percent::. </0>

Totem.name: Carved Statue
Totem.desc: This carving displays your prowess to all Vikings of the land!

Temple.name: Altar of Kings
Temple.desc: The Altar of Kings provides +::value::$icon(Food) +::value2::$icon(Wood) +::value3::$icon(Money) and +::value4::$icon(Lore) for every ::value6::$icon(Fame). It also provides +::value5::[Fame] when built and +::value1::$icon(Happy).
Temple.props.noFameDesc: The Altar of Kings provides +::value::$icon(Food) +::value2::$icon(Wood) +::value3::$icon(Money) +::value4::$icon(Lore) production as well as +::value1::$icon(Happy)

Lighthouse.name: Lighthouse
Lighthouse.desc: Allows you to create Great Routes. Must be built on a [Port]. This one is invulnerable to Kraken attack events.

RavenLighthouse.name: Lighthouse
RavenLighthouse.desc: Allows you to create Great Routes. Must be built on a [RavenPort]. This one is invulnerable to Kraken attack events.

SacrificialPyre.name: Sacrificial Pyre
SacrificialPyre.desc: Sacrifice your thralls or Vikings to gain [Blood].

OxThrone.name: Torfin's Throne
OxThrone.desc: This is the throne of the legendary [OxHero]. You will summon him for your clan.

AncientBattleground.name: Ancient Battleground
AncientBattleground.desc: A place where brave souls fell in the burning heat of battle. Send [OxHero] to excavate [Artifact] from here.
AncientBattleground.flavor: Memories of terrible battles fade with time, but powerful remnants remain for those who deserve it.

LureSacred.name: Mythical Lure
LureSacred.desc:
A lure for mythical beasts. They will periodically come in groups hungry for some food.
Each wave cleared increases population growth by ::percent_value::, up to ::percent_value1::.
Destroyed if the zone is colonised by an enemy.
LureSacred.flavor: Make sure you don't end up being said food!

TownHall.name: Town Hall
TownHall.desc: Spawns new [Villager]s when you have enough [Happy].
TownHall.upgrades: <0> Allows you to upgrade other buildings. Increases maximum [Population] by ::value:: and population growth by ::percent1::. </0>

RuneStone.name: Runestone
RuneStone.desc: Assign a villager to become a [RuneMaster] who will produce [Lore].

CircleStone.name: Circle of Stones
CircleStone.desc: Assign your villagers to become [RuneMaster]s. All Loremasters in this area will produce ::percent:: more [Lore].

Fertility.name: Fertile Land
Fertility.desc: You can build [Fields] here and recruit [Farmer]s.
Fertility.flavor: A little gift from Gefjon, the goddess of plowing.

Stones.name: Stone Deposit
Stones.desc: You can build a mine here to extract [Stone].

DeathCamp.name: Draugr Tombs
DeathCamp.desc: [Death]s will rise from this place until you take control of it.

Ruins.name: Ruins
Ruins.desc: Treasure is waiting to be found here, but only [Scout]s will have the courage to venture within. Colonize first to explore.

IronDeposit.name: Iron Deposit
IronDeposit.desc: You can build an Iron Mine here to extract [Iron] ore.

RimeSteelDeposit.name: Rimesteel Deposit
RimeSteelDeposit.desc: You can build a Mine here to extract [RimeSteel] ore.
RimeSteelDeposit.flavor: A mysterious metal found only in the coldest environments. Said to be the only material that can pierce an [IceWorm]'s shell.

GemstoneDeposit.name: Gemstone Deposit
GemstoneDeposit.desc: You can build a [Mine] here to extract [Gemstone]s.

WolvesCave.name: Wolf Den
WolvesCave.desc: [Wolf]s will spawn in this area until you claim it.

Grove.name: Forest
Grove.desc: Improves [Wood] production in this area by ::percent::.
Grove.flavor: At Yule, Vikings would traditionally decorate large evergreen trees with carvings, gifts and food, urging spring to return faster.

DeerSpawner.name: Deer
DeerSpawner.desc: This area is full of deer, making it a great place to hunt.

MarshBuilding.name: Swamp
MarshBuilding.desc: Unstable ground makes it harder to build in this area.

BrokenShores.name: Shipwreck
BrokenShores.desc: Colonize and use your [Scout]s to explore this wreck, where you will find [Money] and [Wood].

GiantCamp.name: Jötunn Camp
GiantCamp.desc: [Giant]s are usually peaceful... Trade enough [Food] with them and they might join you.

MyrkalfarHouse.name: Myrkálfar Camp
MyrkalfarHouse.desc: The dwelling of the [Myrkalfar]s is also their base of operations. Destroying it might be the only way to stop them. Don't let them enter your territory, they're a gang of thieves...

KoboldHouse.name: Kobold Camp
KoboldHouse.desc: [Kobold]s will spawn here and spread to nearby territories.

DraugrPortal.name: Draugr Portal
DraugrPortal.desc: [Death]s will soon come pouring through this portal. We must prepare!

Vegvisir.name: Vegvisir
Vegvisir.desc: Source of incredible knowledge. Increases building, repairing and forging speed by ::percent::.

ThorWrath.name: Thor's Wrath
ThorWrath.desc: An ancient place of power. Gives +::percent:: attack bonus to military units.

Geyser.name: Geyser
Geyser.desc: A warm and pleasant area. Gives +::value::[Happy] and ::inv_percent1:: [Wood] consumption in winter if controlled.

AncientGraveyard.name: Ancient Graveyard
AncientGraveyard.desc: You can send [RuneMaster]s to study these burial grounds, and maybe find unexpected allies.
AncientGraveyard.flavor: To a trained eye, it is obvious that Seidr, an ancient form of sorcery Freyia taught the Æsir, was practiced here.

BrokenHouse.name: Damaged House
BrokenHouse.desc: Colonize and use your [Scout]s to explore this house, where you will find [Money] and [Wood].

Bifrost.name: Bifröst
Bifrost.desc: The legendary bridge that leads to Asgard, where the major gods, the Æsir, are said to live. Protect it at all costs!
Bifrost.flavor: "Bifröst" is believed to mean "shimmering path." The bridge is also called "Asbru," the Æsir's bridge.

BifrostLore.name: Sleeping Bifröst
BifrostLore.desc: You must colonize its zone first, then gather lore to activate this legendary Bridge.

Anvil.name: Anvil of Gods
Anvil.desc: Assign your villagers to become [Smith]s. Allows you to forge the Sword of Odin.

Muspell.name: Gate of Muspell
Muspell.desc: This gateway connects Northgard and Muspelheim, the realm of fire. [GiantFire]s will spawn here until someone is brave enough to seal it.
Muspell.flavor: Muspelheim is the southernmost of the nine worlds supported by the world tree Yggdrasil.

MuspellConquest.name: Gate of Muspell
MuspellConquest.desc: This gateway connects Northgard and Muspelheim, the realm of fire. [GiantFire]s will spawn here forever.
MuspellConquest.flavor: Muspelheim is the southernmost of the nine worlds supported by the world tree Yggdrasil.

Niflheim.name: Gate of Niflheim
Niflheim.desc: This gateway will summon armies of frozen warriors. There is no way to stop them, you must survive.

PillarOfGod.name: Pillar of Glory
PillarOfGod.desc: Assign a villager to become a [Scholar] who will produce [Fame].

FountainFame.name: Mimirsbrunn
FountainFame.desc: Assign a [Villager] to become a [RuneMaster] and produce [Lore]. They may discover a new knowledge from another clan.

FountainHealth.name: Urdarbrunn
FountainHealth.desc: Gives a ::percent:: bonus of [Healing] to all your healers. Allows the use of [Cleanse] ability.

TallGrass.name: Landvidi
TallGrass.desc: Don’t get lost in the tall grass. All units inside gain [Invisibility], which make them undetectable to the outside.

PoisonousSwamp.name: Poisonous Swamp
PoisonousSwamp.desc: Spread a poisonous gas which hurts and slows down anything that pass through.

BrambleField.name: Naströnd
BrambleField.desc: Thick thorns prevent anything from passing except the most agile of men. They can be cleared by a [Scout] and will give some [Wood] afterward.

Meteor.name: Molten Rock
Meteor.desc: An unnatural glow surrounds this rock. Mine it quickly or face the magic within!

Snowman.name: Snowman
Snowman.desc: A long lasting snowman thanks to the lovely Northgard Weather.
Snowman.flavor: Do you wanna build a snowman?

RelicHammer.name: Mjöllnir
RelicHammer.desc: Summons a thunderstorm on a zone, damaging all units and buildings during one month.

RelicShield.name: Svalinn
RelicShield.desc: +::percent0:: defense for units in this zone. Can be moved into another zone within your territory. Protects the zone against some negative effects that target it.

RelicCauldron.name: Eldhrumnir
RelicCauldron.desc: +::percent0:: Feast Bonus, ::percent1:: Feast cost. Your units regenerate health during a feast

RelicCup.name: Bragaful
RelicCup.desc: You gain a [Money] bonus depending of your [Prestige]. Your [Lighthouse] has a fourth great trade route (-60 [Money], +20 [Prestige], +9 [Happy])

RelicPillar.name: Jörmunr
RelicPillar.desc: You gain a [Lore] bonus depending on number of zones in your territory. You can colonize zones with Lore.

RelicStag.name: Hlidskjalf
RelicStag.desc: Your warchief gains the [Annexation] ability. Whenever your warchief decolonizes a zone, you colonize it for free.

RelicGoat.name: Gefjun's Jar
RelicGoat.desc: You can summon new villagers for [Food] depending on your population. They will arrive at your [TownHall] by boat. Sometimes, [Sheep] can replace one villager. Required happiness for your population is reduced. You can build an additional [Sheepfold].

RelicWolf.name: Horn of Managarm
RelicWolf.desc: Summons up to 3 [WhiteWolf]s under your control.

RelicRaven.name: Naglfar
RelicRaven.desc: Sends a raid on a coastal tile with 2 [GiantCrow]s

RelicBear.name: Scabbard of Gram
RelicBear.desc: Your Warchief wields the sword Gram. Enemies hit by Gram are frozen, along with the area around them. Gives +15% attack, +15% defense to Shield Maiden.

RelicBoar.name: Mask of Gullinbursti
RelicBoar.desc: +::value::[Food] production. Reveal all [Grove]s. Summon a non controllable [GiantBoar] in all forests. Boars in allied territory are pacified. You can sacrifice boars in your territory for [Food].

RelicSnake.name: Gungnir
RelicSnake.desc: Unlocks the [Stealth] ability for all your military units.

RelicHorse.name: Dainsleif & Tyrfing
RelicHorse.desc: Your Warchiefs gain +20% attack, +20% defense and +20% max life. Their mining and forging speed is also increased by +20%.

RelicKraken.name: Edda of Vor
RelicKraken.desc: You gain 1000 [Prescience] when you build this relic. Your [Norn]s also produce [Fame].

RelicOx.name: Aegir
RelicOx.desc: [OxHero] can use [Provocation]: all enemy units and towers target [OxHero] during a short period and his defense is increased by ::percent1:: for ::value:: seconds.

RelicLynx.name: Gleipnir
RelicLynx.desc: Place a [Trap] in a non-enemy zone. Activate on demand to reveal spikes that damage and slow down the enemy as long as he stays within. Last ::value1:: seconds.

Yggdrasil.name: Yggdrasil
Yggdrasil.desc: The world tree is threatened by evil forces.

WyvernDen.name: Wyvern's Den
WyvernDen.desc: Fight the Wyvern to earn many [Fame] and [MilitaryXP]
WyvernDen.flavor: Everything is under control as long as the Wyvern is asleep ...

BigSword.name: Sword of the Gods
BigSword.desc: Assign your villagers to become [RuneMaster]s. All Loremasters in this area will produce ::percent:: more [Lore].

Helheim.name: Gate of Helheim
Helheim.desc: This portal connects Northgard to Helheim, the realm of the dead. [Valkyrie]s and [Death]s will spawn here until someone is brave enough to confront them.

MagmaFlow.name: Magma Flow
MagmaFlow.desc: The magma in this area can be used to craft very powerful weapons.

Volcano.name: Volcano
Volcano.desc: A dangerous active volcano. Watch out for flying [Meteor]s!

IceThrone.name: Seal of Valhalla
IceThrone.desc: By controling this seal, [LichKing] prevent souls to go to Valhalla and bring them back as draugar.

ColliderSquare.name: Square Collider
ColliderSquare.desc: An invisible square collider to give consistence to decorative elements.

ColliderRectangle.name: Rectangle Collider
ColliderRectangle.desc: An invisible rectangle collider to give consistence to decorative elements.

ColliderOcto.name: Octagonal Collider
ColliderOcto.desc: An invisible octagonal collider to give consistence to decorative elements.

RelicGeneric.name: Relic
RelicGeneric.desc: You must create a relic in the [Forge] before you can build it.

Lumber.name: Sharp Axes
Lumber.desc: คนตัดไม้จะผลิตไม้มากขึ้น ::percent::

Weaponsmith.name: Weaponsmith
Weaponsmith.desc: เพิ่มพลังโจมตีของหน่วยทหารทั้งหมด ของคุณขึ้น ::percent::

Mining.name: Mining Efficiency
Mining.desc: [Miner] สกัดแร่เร็วขึ้น ::percent::

Colonize.name: Colonization
Colonize.desc: ลดจำนวน [Food] ที่จำเป็นในการตั้งรกรากพื้นที่หนึ่ง ::inv_percent::

BetterSilo.name: Eradication
BetterSilo.desc: [FoodSilo] ได้รับโบนัสการผลิต [Food] ขึ้น ::percent:: และยังลดต้นทุนการอัพเกรด [FoodSilo] ::percent_value1::

Coats.name: Fur Coats
Coats.desc: ยูนิตของคุณพลังไม่ลดลงในช่วงฤดูหนาวอีกต่อไป

Defense.name: Defensive Strategy
Defense.desc: เพิ่มการโจมตีของพลเรือนและความต้านทานของ Defense Towers' ของคุณขึ้น ::percent::

Drakkars.name: Shipbuilding
Drakkars.desc: เพิ่มการผลิตทรัพยากรของ [Sailor] ขึ้น ::percent::

Coinage.name: Coinage
Coinage.desc: [Merchant] ของคุณจะผลิต [Money] มากขึ้น ::percent::

Recruit.name: Recruitment
Recruit.desc: เพิ่มความเร็วในการเติบโตของประชากรขึ้น ::percent0:: อย่างถาวร, คุณจะได้รับเพิ่มอีก ::percent_value1:: ในช่วงเดือน ::value2:: ต่อยูนิตจากเผ่าของคุณที่ถูกสังหารโดยศัตรูหรือถูกทำลาย (สูงสุด ::percent_value3::)

Medecine.name: Medicine
Medecine.desc: เพิ่มความเร็วในการรักษาของ [Healer] ขึ้น ::percent::

MilitaryStrategy.name: Military Strategy
MilitaryStrategy.desc: Military units gain +::percent_value:: attack for each type of friendly military unit in the area (max +::percent_value1::).

Security.name: Feeling Safe
Security.desc: Gain +::value::[Happy] if you have a [Hero01] and +::value1::[Happy] per upgraded military camp.
Security.props.firstNameDesc: Gain +::value::[Happy] if you have [Hero01] and +::value1::[Happy] per upgraded military camp.

Knowledge.name: Erudition
Knowledge.desc: Increases [RuneMaster] production by ::percent::. First [CarvedStone] is free.

Upgrades.name: Carpentry Mastery
Upgrades.desc: ลดค่าอัพเกรดสิ่งปลูกสร้างของคุณลง ::inv_percent::

HeartStone.name: Hearthstone
HeartStone.desc: ลดการใช้ ไม้ฟืน ในช่วงฤดูหนาวลง ::inv_percent:: และลดโทษของอาหารในช่วงฤดูหนาวลง ::inv_percent1::

SlotGrowth.name: Shiny Happy People
SlotGrowth.desc: -::inv_percent:: ความต้องการความสุขตามจำนวนประชากรของคุณ

Heroes.name: Legendary Heroes
Heroes.desc: เพิ่มการโจมตีและการป้องกันของ [Hero01] ของคุณขึ้น ::percent::

MonsterSlayer.name: Monster Slayer
MonsterSlayer.desc: Improves your military units' attack by ::percent:: against mystical creatures. Also increases ::xp_type:: gains by ::percent_value1:: for each mystical creature killed.

Negociate.name: Negotiation
Negociate.desc: Reduces Marketplace prices by ::inv_percent:: and stock replenishment is ::percent1:: faster.

SlotWealth.name: Trading Caravan
SlotWealth.desc: Trading routes earn ::percent:: more [Money]. Relations with neutral factions improve ::percent1:: faster.

Ascetic.name: Field Rations
Ascetic.desc: ลดการบริโภค [Food] ของหน่วยทหารของคุณลง ::inv_percent::

Pillage.name: Spoils of War
Pillage.desc: รับ [Money] สำหรับยูนิตศัตรูแต่ละตัวที่ถูกสังหาร

Plunder.name: Plunder
Plunder.desc: เมื่อคุณแย่งชิงอาณานิคมได้, ยูนิตของคุณที่อยู่ในพื้นที่นั้นจะได้รับพลังชีวิต +::percent::

Conqueror.name: Invader
Conqueror.desc: เพิ่มพลังกลุ่มนักรบของคุณกับ Defense Towers ขึ้น ::percent::, และทำให้การแย่งชิงอาณานิคมเร็วขึ้นเป็นสองเท่า

Threats.name: Veiled Threats
Threats.desc: Improves your Trade Routes' [Money] income by ::percent:: if you have a [Hero01] and by ::percent1:: with the [Hero01] in the same zone as the [TradingPost]. You can trade even when at war.

MoreAssign.name: Industrious
MoreAssign.desc: อาคารผลิตอาหารที่ได้รับการอัพเกรด สามารถมอบหมายชาวบ้านเพิ่มเติมได้

FreeTools.name: Spare Tools
FreeTools.desc: Tool improvement for [Farmer]s, [Hunter]s and [Fisherman]s costs no [Money] or [Iron], and forging time for those tools is divided by ::value::.

MoreBuildings.name: Amenities
MoreBuildings.desc: เสียค่าใช้จ่ายน้อยลง ::inv_percent:: ในการพัฒนาโซน

Barricades.name: Barricades
Barricades.desc: เพิ่มความต้านทานของพลเรือนของคุณ ::percent:: ต่อสิ่งปลูกสร้างในพื้นที่

FoodTrade.name: Food Trade
FoodTrade.desc: Trading food increases your Trade Routes' [Money] income by ::percent:: and by ::percent1:: on tiles with a natural food source.

BuildingUpkeep.name: Food Preservation
BuildingUpkeep.desc: Increases [Food] production by +::value1:: and [Happy] by +::value2:: for each [FoodSilo] (+::value:: [Food] if upgraded).

HeroEmblem.name: Hero Emblem
HeroEmblem.desc: [Stone] cost to build an [Temple] is reduced to ::value2::. It gives +::value:: [Happy] and produces [Fame].

ProudStag.name: Young and Proud
ProudStag.desc: Increases your military units' attack power by ::percent_value:: for every positive [Happy] you have (currently ::nb::% - 25% max).

GreatDeeds.name: The Value of Great Deeds
GreatDeeds.desc: Skalds will produce +::value::[Money] (+::value1:: if their building is upgraded). Skalds' tool improvement is free and forging time is divided by ::value2::.

GloryClan.name: Glory of the Clan
GloryClan.desc:
Increases [Fame] by ::percent::.
Increases gains from Trade Routes and Great Trade Routes by ::percent1::.

Rangers.name: Rangers
Rangers.desc: เพิ่มความเร็วในการสอดแนมและการสำรวจของคุณขึ้น ::percent::, หน่วยสอดแนมของคุณไม่กิน [Food] อีกต่อไป และจะไม่ได้รับบาดเจ็บขณะสำรวจ

MilitaryFunds.name: Gear Upgrade
MilitaryFunds.desc:
Gives you ::percent_value:: attack power and defense for each active [Sailor] or [Merchant]. (currently ::nb::% - ::percent_value1:: max)
Cost of Weapon improvements reduced by ::inv_percent2::.

GreatExplorers.name: Journeymen
GreatExplorers.desc: เพิ่ม [Happy] ของคุณตามพื้นที่ที่คุณสำรวจ

Wealth.name: Exotic Goods
Wealth.desc: ได้รับ +::value::[Happy] ต่อ Harbor, +::value1::[Happy] ถ้าอัพเกรด

Negociators.name: Negotiators
Negociators.desc: ได้รับการผลิต +::value::[Money] และ ::percent1::[Prestige]

Hibernate.name: Hibernation
Hibernate.desc: Your non-sick clan members heal during winter in allied territory.

LandProtect.name: Protector of the Land
LandProtect.desc: Gain +::value::[Happy] per area with at least one military camp.

ShieldMaster.name: Shield Mastery
ShieldMaster.desc: [ShieldBearer]s cost less [Money], and their resistance is increased by ::percent::. [ShieldCenter] have no upkeep cost.

Harpoons.name: Harpoons
Harpoons.desc: Fisherman's Huts can have one more [Fisherman], and their production is increased by ::percent::.

WinterFestival.name: Winter Festival
WinterFestival.desc: During winter, [Food] production loss is reduced by ::inv_percent::, [Happy] is increased by ::value1:: and [Money] earned from trade routes is increased by ::percent2::.

Bartering.name: Bartering
Bartering.desc: Neutral factions will accept any resources and you gain +::value::[Happy] when trading with them.

LayLayLand.name: Lay of the Land
LayLayLand.desc: Reduces environment hostility by ::inv_percent::. Increases non villager productions by +::percent1:: in [Grove]s, [MarshBuilding]s or [Shoal]s.

Herbalism.name: Herbalism
Herbalism.desc: Each active [Mender] provides +::percent:: production in [MenderHut] territory (+::percent2:: for [Lore] production). Increases your [Mender]s' healing speed by ::percent1::.

Handiwork.name: Handiwork
Handiwork.desc: Non-upgraded buildings receive +::percent:: production. -::inv_percent1:: buildings upkeep costs.

Legacy.name: Legacy
Legacy.desc: Increases [Happy] and productions yields from [Temple] by +::percent::

Osmosis.name: Osmosis
Osmosis.desc: You obtain ::value1:: [Happy] for every ::value2:: colonized zones. Zones with [Grove]s, [MarshBuilding]s or [Shoal]s provide ::value::[Happy].

BlackMarket.name: Black Market
BlackMarket.desc:
[Merchant]s produce +::percent1:: more [Money].
You gain +::percent::[Money] when trading with enemy clan, deteriorating diplomatic relations. You can trade even when at war. Enemy clans get no resource from black market trading.

Guerilla.name: Guerilla Tactics
Guerilla.desc: Permanently increases your military units' attack power by +::percent:: for any unit slain or lost in enemy territory (currently ::nb::% - ::max::% max).

Rapacious.name: Rapacious Exploitation
Rapacious.desc:
[Ruins]s and [BrokenShores]s in your territory provide +::value::[Happy].
Bonuses from special zones are doubled.

UnderPressure.name: Under Pressure
UnderPressure.desc:
You gain +::value::[Happy] and +::value2::[Food] for each military unit in a non allied zone next to or within an enemy territory. (Currently ::nb::)
Increases the [Skirmisher]s' attack power by ::percent1:: and other military units' attack power by ::percent3::. [Skirmisher]s are less affected by the attack penalty from their distance to Town Hall.

HardLabor.name: Hard Labor
HardLabor.desc: [Slave]s can be conscripted to production buildings to increase their output (maximum of 1 per building).

BloodTears.name: Blood, Sweat & Tears
BloodTears.desc: You can assign ::value:: extra [Slave]s to production buildings.

Capture.name: Capture
Capture.desc:
Military units have a chance to enslave wounded enemy civilians or neutral faction units.
Enslaved [Myrkalfar]s count as ::value2:: [Slave]s, [Giant]s count as ::value3:: [Slave]s. Chance of capture is multiplied by ::value1:: if your [Hero01] is in the zone.

SlaveTrade.name: Slave Trade
SlaveTrade.desc: [Slave]s are ::inv_percent:: cheaper, and minimum price is also reduced by ::inv_percent::.

Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Frenzy.desc: +::percent:: attack power for a military unit with no other military allies in their zone.

Metalcraft.name: Metalcraft
Metalcraft.desc: Warchiefs mining and forge speed is increased by +::percent::

BFTower.name: Great Tower
BFTower.desc: A second upgrade for Watch Towers giving +50% attack power +50% structure

AncestralInfluence.name: Ancestral Influence
AncestralInfluence.desc: Relics don't use a building slot. Zones with or adjacent to an active relic gain +::percent:: prod

QualityLife.name: Quality of Life
QualityLife.desc: ::value:: [Happy] per territory with upgraded civilian buildings (except houses)

NearTheSea.name: Near The Sea Spirit
NearTheSea.desc: Generates +::value:: [Money] and +::value:: [Prescience] every ::value1:: buildings on coastal zones.

EndlessTide.name: Endless Tide
EndlessTide.desc: Increases all your military units' attack power by ::percent2::. Reduces the cost of military units by ::inv_percent::. Each military camp gives +::value1:: [Warband].

FromBeyond.name: Knowledge from Beyond
FromBeyond.desc:
Reveals all neutral factions.
All trade routes give you +::value1:: [Lore].
Trade routes with neutral factions earn you +::percent:: more [Money].

FreshFish.name: Fresh Fish
FreshFish.desc: [Fisherman]s produce +::percent:: more [Food]. Their tool improvements are free and their forging time is divided by ::value1::.

CityBuilder.name: City Builder
CityBuilder.desc: Improving a zone is ::inv_percent2:: cheaper. In improved zones, specialized units get a +::percent:: production bonus and buildings have a -::inv_percent1:: upkeep cost.

MilitaryTraining.name: Military Training
MilitaryTraining.desc: Idle military units in your territory gain [MilitaryXP]. Upgrading [TrainingCamp] costs ::percent_value1:: of its normal costs.

Hydromel.name: Ferocious Charge
Hydromel.desc:
[Warrior]s gain ::percent:: damage on a charge attack.
Weapons are ::percent1:: faster to forge and cost ::percent_value2:: less.

InvincibleHero.name: Unstoppable
InvincibleHero.desc:
[OxHero] gain +::percent:: attack power and defense for each discovered [Artifact].
Whenever a unit dies in the same zone as [OxHero], his health slowly regenerates by ::percent_value1:: of the dead unit's max health.

GameDinner.name: Spoils of Plenty
GameDinner.desc:
The next feast's cost is reduced by ::percent_value1:: (up to ::percent_value2::) per animal your clan killed.
+::value:: [Happy] during a feast.
Also give one free [FoodSilo] upgrade.

TowerArrows.name: Defensive Arrows
TowerArrows.desc: [WatchTower]s are equiped with the [Tracker]'s arrows you have selected in the [Archery].

Vitality.name: Nimble Paws
Vitality.desc: Lynxes frequently leap and dodge every attack while airbone. Gives [LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite] +::percent:: max life.

Poaching.name: Poaching
Poaching.desc:
Allows you to sell [HuntTrophy]s in the [MarketPlace].
[Merchant]s produce +::percent:: more [Money].

ExtraLure.name: The Wild Hunt
ExtraLure.desc:
[LynxHero] can place one additional lure at a time.
[SummonWildHunt] spirits gain +::percent:: attack power.

GotBerserk.name: Dominion
GotBerserk.desc: Your [Berserker] can colonize cleared areas for free.

MilitaryWolf.name: Assault
MilitaryWolf.desc: Your military units gain a ::percent:: attack bonus when fighting outside your territory. [Berserker]'s Dominion cooldown is reduced by ::percent_value1::

HomeCook.name: Shepherd
HomeCook.desc: Gives ::value:: free [Sheep]s. You can have an additional [Sheepfold] and their [Food] production is increased by +::percent1::.

FeastResist.name: Teamwork
FeastResist.desc: You gain ::value1:: free feast per year. Your Defense Towers and all your military units gain ::percent:: resistance when feasting.

Dedication.name: Dedication
Dedication.desc:
Upgraded buildings gain an additional ::percent:: production bonus.
Increases all production by +::percent_value1:: every ::value2:: [Fame]. ::currently_sentence::

Recruits.name: Recruits
Recruits.desc: You receive ::value:: [Villager]s, ::value:: max population and ::value1::[Happy]. [Sailor]s produce +::percent3:: [Fame]. Allows to trade with your Homeland at better rates.

Mercenaries.name: Mercenaries
Mercenaries.desc:
You can hire [Mercenary]s at your [RavenPort] and send them to raid coastal areas.
You can assign ::value:: more [Sailor] in your [RavenPort]s.

KindredSpirit.name: Kindred Spirit
KindredSpirit.desc: Having [BearMaiden] or a [Maiden] in an area increases local production by ::percent::.

BearAwake.name: The Bear Awakens
BearAwake.desc: You gain +::value::[Fame] per enemy unit killed in an area with the [Maiden]. Your military units gain +::percent_value1:: power per ::value2::[Fame]. [BearMaiden] can now go in enemy territory.

OldKnowledge.name: Heritage
OldKnowledge.desc: +::value:: free Knowledge (does not count toward a Lore victory or Blessing unlock).

GreaterBlessings.name: Greater Blessings
GreaterBlessings.desc:
Freya: Winter penalty is massively reduced (::inv_percent0:: for [Food], ::inv_percent1:: for [Wood])
Baldr: +::value2:: [Happy] and +::value4:: [Lore] production
Jörd: Your army and upgraded towers get +::percent_value3:: attack power

PrideSnake.name: Pride of the Clan
PrideSnake.desc: [WarchiefSnake] moves faster and can now attack at range.

SignyStealth.name: Shadow of the Wild
SignyStealth.desc: [WarchiefSnake] can go through neutral zones without engaging in combat.

ScorchedEarth.name: Scorched Earth
ScorchedEarth.desc:
[WarchiefSnake] can use [ScorchedEarth] to burn any area over ::value0:: months (::value3:: months cooldown).
Burned zone : -::percent_value1:: production, snakes units and buildings +::percent_value2:: attack. Pillages enemy resources.

EmpireGrowth.name: Reluctant Workforce
EmpireGrowth.desc: Receive 5 [Slave]s. Your [Blood] gauge is extended, and bonuses are increased.

Jealous.name: Tenacious Grudge
Jealous.desc: +::percent_value:: attack power against an opponent for each victory condition in which they are ahead of you (Commerce, Lore and Fame). Your [Blood] gauge is complete, and bonuses are increased.

Craftsmen.name: Craftsmen
Craftsmen.desc:
Improved tools for civilians get an additionnal +::percent0:: production bonus.
Selling Stone or Iron earns +::percent1:: krowns. Allies receive double resource.

EarthLegacy.name: Legacy of the Earth
EarthLegacy.desc:
You discover ::value:: Stone and ::value:: Iron deposits in your territory.
You can build a second relic (max 1 relic per zone).

FutureSight.name: Future Sight
FutureSight.desc:
You obtain ::value:: [Prescience]. Events are now revealed long sooner than other clans.
Your clan feasts each time the Kraken approach the coasts.

SeaHowl.name: Howl of the Sea Master
SeaHowl.desc: Military units killed in a neutral or enemy zone have a chance to become [SpecterWarrior], joining your ranks under your orders.

MilitaryPressure.name: Military Pressure
MilitaryPressure.desc: Non villager unit productions have a bonus depending on the number of military units you control.

TrueHero.name: The True Hero
TrueHero.desc: Unlock [Dash] ability for [OxHero]. He can target an enemy building and he will destroy it immediately by charging at it. Enemy units becomes feared during the charge.

Baits.name: Lures
Baits.desc: Unlock [SacredLure] ability for the [LynxHero]. Once placed, it periodically attracts Mythical beasts to the zone, more and more as time passes. Each wave cleared increases population growth

WildHunt.name: Oskoreia
WildHunt.desc: Unlock [SummonWildHunt] ability for the [LynxHero]. She can recall the strongest and recent wave of Mythical Animals the clan killed. In their spirit form, they come back for a last rampage on earth.

Cartography.name: DEPRECATED
Cartography.desc: You explore areas controlled by another clan ::percent:: faster.

SharpWeapons.name: DEPRECATED
SharpWeapons.desc: Increases your military units' attack power by ::percent::.

ImprovedHall.name: DEPRECATED
ImprovedHall.desc: Gain +::value::[Money] production. Enables Trade Routes with [TradingPost]s and Great Trade Routes with a [Lighthouse].

CommunalProd.name: DEPRECATED
CommunalProd.desc: Each [Villager] produce some [Food], [Wood], [Money], [Lore] if they are produced in the same zone.

FreyaBlessing.name: Freya's Blessing
FreyaBlessing.desc: Reduces loss of [Food] production during winter by ::inv_percent0:: and [Wood] consumption by ::inv_percent1::.

FinalBlessing.name: Ancestral Knowledge
FinalBlessing.desc: Required to achieve a Wisdom victory.

FountainWisdom.name: Fountain of Wisdom
FountainWisdom.desc: You received blessing from the [FountainFame], you can choose a knowledge from another clan.

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.title: The Clan of the Wolf
Wolf.desc: Aggressive, protective of their freedom, and more than a little reckless. They are well prepared to face the dangers of Northgard and use their combined might and mobility to leave little chance to all but the most resilient.
Wolf.bonuses: <0> Killing [Wolf]s and [Bear]s provides [Meat]. </0> <1> Your military units consume ::inv_percent:: less [Food] and provide [Happy]. </1> <2> If you have no military units, the first one you recruit is free. </2>

Stag.name: Stag
Stag.title: The Clan of the Stag
Stag.desc: Proud of their legacy of astonishing achievements, they are renowned as much for their honorable and regal manner as for their harsh justice and unyielding strength. Valuing wealth and fame, they are highly ambitious expansionists.
Stag.bonuses: <0> You start with +::value::[Food], +::value1::[Wood], +::value2::[Money] and +::value3::[Lore]. </0> <1> The Hall of [Skald]s replaces the [Tavern] and produces additional [Fame]. </1>

Goat.name: Goat
Goat.title: The Clan of the Goat
Goat.desc: When it comes to surviving in dangerous conditions and building sturdy settlements, the Goat Clan has no rival. They will endure and survive no matter what.
Goat.bonuses: <0> Starts with one [Sheep] and can build two [Sheepfold]s. </0> <1> Increases the production bonus of your feasts by ::percent::. </1>

Raven.name: Raven
Raven.title: The Clan of the Raven
Raven.desc: Great explorers and merchants, their mighty fleet allowed them to be the first to land on Northgard. They are strong trade partners if you don’t mind their constant scheming. Brash and swift, they will often be found roaming where you least expect them.
Raven.bonuses: <0> Can colonize with [Money] instead of [Food]. </0> <1> Can build the [RavenPort] to explore coastal areas and later send [Mercenary]s to attack. </1> <2> Gain +::percent::[Money] from [Merchant]s and [Sailor]s </2>

Bear.name: Bear
Bear.title: The Clan of the Bear
Bear.desc: Stalwart protectors of the land, the Bjarki clan claims the most resilient warriors. Hailing from the northern reaches of the realm, they are also very well equipped to survive the harsh winters of Northgard.
Bear.bonuses: <0> Food and Firewood penalties in winter are reduced by ::inv_percent::. </0> <1> You can summon [BearMaiden] to your [TrainingCamp]. </1> <2> Instead of having reduced power, your military units gain ::percent:: resistance bonus during the winter. </2>

Boar.name: Boar
Boar.title: The Clan of the Boar
Boar.desc: A reclusive bunch forgotten by the other clans and recently rediscovered, the Boar Clan is both mystical and untamed. Their understanding of the world is unmatched, as are their boorish and primitive ways.
Boar.bonuses: <0> The [Mender]'s Hut replaces the Healer's Hut. Menders produce +::value::[Lore] while not healing. </0> <1> Each additional territory gives ::value:: max population. </1> <2> No penalties to [Happy] for non-upgraded [House]s and [TownHall]. </2> <3> Learning a new knowledge gives a +::value:: Fame bonus. </3>

Snake.name: Snake
Snake.title: The Clan of the Snake
Snake.desc: Cunning and deceitful, the Snake has little regard for fame or honour. Members of the clan prefer working in the shadows and using guerilla tactics rather than open warfare.
Snake.bonuses: <0> You start with your warchief, the young Signy. She can be summoned again without Iron </0> <1> Signy grows up, getting stronger each year until the 10th year. </1> <2> You can build [SkirmishCenter]s. The [Skirmisher]s they train are mobile light troops specialized in harassment. </2> <3> The clan doesn't have access to Fame. </3>

Dragon.name: Dragon
Dragon.title: The Clan of the Dragon
Dragon.desc: The most outlandish of all clans, the Dragons follow ancient customs and embrace freakish traditions. They use sacrifice and slavery to further their goals, often earning the other clans' distrust.
Dragon.bonuses: <0> Your civilians can go into neutral territory. </0> <1> No Happiness or production penalty for being wounded. </1> <2> You start with a [SacrificialPyre]. You can build a [DragonmenCamp] instead of other military camps. </2> <3> Start with 2 [Slave]s and only 3 [Villager]s. You can buy thralls from your [Port]s. </3>

Horse.name: Horse
Horse.title: The Clan of the Horse
Horse.desc: Led by Brok and Eitria, two spirited siblings, the clan of the Horse are a quiet and sturdy people. They are also recognized by all as the best craftsmen and women of the known world.
Horse.bonuses: <0> You have two Warchiefs who can be summoned from [ForgeHorse] whithout Iron. </0> <1> Your Warchiefs can mine and forge (at +10% speed). </1> <2> You don't have access to mines, miners or smiths. </2> <3> Your villagers have ::percent:: build and repair speed. </3>

Kraken.name: Kraken
Kraken.title: The Clan of the Kraken
Kraken.desc: The Clan of the Kraken knows firsthand how dangerous the sea can be. They worship the gigantic behemoth, fearing its brutal might, honoring its instinctual knowledge, and using its powers when he deigns to bestow them.
Kraken.bonuses: <0> Colonization and building costs on non-coastal zone are ::percent:: more expensive. </0> <1> All units' attack power is reduced by ::inv_percent:: on non-coastal zone. </1> <2> You can't build Longship Docks. Trade Victory is not available to you. </2> <3> The [FishermanHouse] is replaced by the [Fishery]. It can be used to fish in both lakes and sea. </3> <4> The [Tavern] is replaced by the [Horgr] to assign female [VillagerWoman]s into [Norn]. The [Norn] produce [Happy] and [Prescience]. </4> <5> [Prescience] may be used to activate special abilities. </5>

Ox.name: Ox
Ox.title: The Clan of the Ox
Ox.desc: Led by Torfin, an ancient leader who returned to help his progeny, it is known for its tremendous might and unrelenting devotion to its ancestors. While they may not be the fastest starters, once they've gained some momentum, they can crush anyone and anything in their way.
Ox.bonuses: <0> Your warchief is the powerful [OxHero]. He can find [Artifact]s from [AncientBattleground] and equip them to become even stronger. </0> <1> Your units are tougher, larger and eat more than the other clans, and have a ::percent:: attack power and defense bonus. </1> <2> Specialized civilian units have a ::percent:: production bonus, except [RuneMaster]s. </2> <3> Any building can hold only one unit, [House]s hold less people. </3>

Lynx.name: Lynx
Lynx.title: The Clan of the Lynx
Lynx.desc: Hunters for a living, members of the clan are known for their excellent archery skills and their unique lures. Led by the Beastmaster, they took Brundr & Kaelinn under their wing when they were just cubs. Now they are her eyes.
Lynx.bonuses: <0> Earn [HuntTrophy]s on animal kills. </0> <1> You can summon [LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite] to your [TrainingCamp]. [LynxHero], the Beastmaster is weaker than other warchiefs but does not cost [Iron]. </1> <2> The [Archery] replaces the Axe Thrower Camp. The [Tracker]s they train are ranged units shooting a wide set of arrows. </2> <3> The Path of the Hunter replaces Military Paths. Spend [HuntTrophy]s to unlock powerful abilities for [LynxBrown], [LynxWhite] and the [Tracker]s. </3>

Wounded.name: Wounded
Wounded.desc: Wounded clan members have ::inv_percent:: reduced production.

NotHappy.name: Unhappy
NotHappy.desc: Unhappy clan members have ::inv_percent:: reduced production.

WinterMalus.name: Harsh conditions
WinterMalus.desc: Your military units have ::inv_percent:: reduced power during winter outside your territory and 10% inside your territory.

FarFromHome.name: Supply Penalty
FarFromHome.desc: Your military units have up to ::inv_percent:: reduced power depending on their distance from your territory.

HighTide.name: High Tide
HighTide.desc: Kraken building and attack penalties no longer affect this zone.

Stilted.name: Shallow Waters
Stilted.desc: This zone can sustain an additional building. Can be cumulated with Zone Development.

TrapStake.name: Spike Trap
TrapStake.desc: Units cannot enter nor exit this zone.

WMilitaryPath.name: Military Paths
WMilitaryPath.desc: Accumulate military experience through combat and war, and decide what is your path.

WResourcesInfos.name: Resources Infos
WResourcesInfos.desc: Explanation of all the resources and the detail of their flux.

WMilitaryGroup.name: Military Group Assignations
WMilitaryGroup.desc: All your troops are always accessible with the main military group. Additionnaly, you can assign part of your troops to sub groups

WVictory.name: Victory Conditions
WVictory.desc: You can win by Domination, Fame, Trade, Lore and a Special Condition, choose your path to glory.

WUnitStatus.name: Status Icons
WUnitStatus.desc: Explanation of the units, zones or building icons.

WManageUnits.name: Manage Units
WManageUnits.desc: All your population sorted by jobs.

WVoiceChatOptions.name: Mute Options
WVoiceChatOptions.desc: Choose a player to Mute/Unmute voice chat

Blizzard.name: Blizzard
Blizzard.desc: Reduces all production by ::inv_percent:: and doubles Firewood consumption.
Blizzard.announce: The weather is cold this year. We'll have a [Blizzard] this winter, so we need to store a large amount of [Food] and [Wood]!

Rats.name: Rat Infestation
Rats.desc: Rats will devour ::percent_value:: of any [Food] not stored in Silos and bring disease. Your Silos currently protect ::silo::.
Rats.announce: Rats have been reported. We need to store our [Food] in [FoodSilo]s and have [Healer]s to protect against disease.

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.desc: The earthquake will damage some of your buildings.
Earthquake.announce: Tremors have been reported. A big earthquake would seriously damage our buildings unless we store [Wood] to repair them.

DraugrAttack.name: Draugar Invasion
DraugrAttack.desc: [Death]s will soon spawn from the portals.
DraugrAttack.announce: Portals leading to Helheim have opened. We need to take defensive action before the [Death]s arrive!

FallenSailors.name: Fallen Sailors
FallenSailors.desc: These [SpecterWarrior]s used to fight for our side...
FallenSailors.announce: Ahoy! Fallen Sailors are approaching your coasts!

BloodMoon.name: Blood Moon
BloodMoon.desc: All units gain +::percent_value:: attack power when outside of their territory for the duration of the Blood Moon.
BloodMoon.announce: The [BloodMoon] is coming! Prepare for a fight!

Eruption.name: Volcanic Eruption
Eruption.desc: [Meteor] will soon fall on Northgard. They are a good source of stone, as well as a hidden threat.
Eruption.announce: Loud rumbles come out of the volcano! Prepare yourselves!

FrozenSea.name: Frozen Sea
FrozenSea.desc: During this winter, [Sailor]s won't produce resources. Great Trade Routes will stop.
FrozenSea.announce: The Sea will freeze this winter. [Sailor]s won't be able to work until it thaws.

KrakenAttack.name: Kraken Attack
KrakenAttack.desc: The Kraken will prowl the seas, randomly wrecking any ship it encounters.
KrakenAttack.announce: An ominous shade prowls under the sea.

GolemAwake.name: [Golem]s Awakening
GolemAwake.desc: Mine the stone quickly, or face a raging foe!

GameEnd.name: No turning point
GameEnd.desc: Achieve victory before reaching this point or you will be defeated.

LureWaveStart.name: Beasts attack
LureWaveStart.desc: Mythical beasts are prowling around your [LureSacred]. They won't resist it forever and will try to get to it aggressively.

Unfreeze.name: Spring
Unfreeze.desc: The undead army will unfreeze and attack you at the beginning of the 5th summer. We must prepare to survive!
Unfreeze.announce: The undead army will unfreeze and attack you at the beginning of the 5th summer. We must prepare to survive!

FoodRequest.name: Food Request
FoodRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Food] as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.
FoodRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Food] to survive. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.

WoodRequest.name: Wood Request
WoodRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Wood] as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.
WoodRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Wood] to heat the clan's homes and repair their structures. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.

MoneyRequest.name: Kröwn Request
MoneyRequest.desc: Spare Svarn some [Money]s as soon as you can afford to. Should you fail to provide the supplies in time, the rebels will have more trouble resisting the loyalists' assaults.
MoneyRequest.announce: Svarn requests a supply of ::value:: [Money]s to help maintain the clan's troops. Help him and you will get some [Fame] and a [Happy] bonus until the next request.

GiantAttack.name: Attack of Giants
GiantAttack.desc: We should prepare appropriately to resist the next assault; [Giant]s pack quite a punch!
GiantAttack.announce: Our enemy will be sending [Giant]s to crush us. We should brace for an assault of epic proportions.

BifrostEvent.name: Gjallarhorn's Wail
BifrostEvent.desc: Prepare to protect Bifröst and yourself from the Fire Giants.
BifrostEvent.announce: Hvedrung is calling the fierce Fire Giants from Muspell to destroy Bifröst.

IceWormAttack.name: Hrímgandr's Wrath
IceWormAttack.desc: Hrímgandr will wreak havoc in your territory.

HagenReinforcement.name: Search Party
HagenReinforcement.desc: Mercenaries will land on your coasts soon.
HagenReinforcement.announce: ::value:: month(s) before Hagen's search party arrives.

SupplyFromHomeland.name: Supply from Homeland
SupplyFromHomeland.desc: A ship from Homeland brings you new villagers.
SupplyFromHomeland.announce: Homeland will send you new villagers by boat.
SupplyFromHomeland.conquestDesc: "[SupplyFromHomeland]" events appear frequently : New [Villager]s will come to your clan.

Mercenaries.name: Mercenary Raid
Mercenaries.desc: [Mercenary]s have chosen their target. The raid begins!
Mercenaries.announce: A mercenary ship has been spotted near your coasts! You must prepare!
Mercenaries.conquestDesc: "[Mercenaries]" events appear frequently : Boats of fearsome [Mercenary]s will attack you coasts.

Elevation.name: Curse
Elevation.desc: Some of your population turn into [SpecterWarrior]s.
Elevation.announce: Our men got infected by a strange disease!
Elevation.conquestDesc: "[Elevation]" events appear frequently : Some of your population will become [SpecterWarrior]s

FrozenAttack.name: Frozen Attack
FrozenAttack.desc: An army of frozen undeads gather near the [Niflheim]s and will attack you.
FrozenAttack.announce: I feel it, the frozen dead are coming.
FrozenAttack.conquestDesc: "[FrozenAttack]" events appear frequently : Waves of frozen monsters appear to attack you.

FireGiant.name: Invasion from Muspell
FireGiant.announce: The [Muspell]s are glowing. Prepare to fend off the invaders!
FireGiant.conquestDesc: "[FireGiant]" events appear frequently : Waves of gigantic [GiantFire]s comes to destroy you.

HelheimInvasion.name: Invasion from Helheim
HelheimInvasion.announce: Stop the Invasion! You must colonize at least ::value:: [Helheim] gate.
HelheimInvasion.conquestDesc: "[HelheimInvasion]" events appear frequently : [Helheim]s will summon quantity of [Death]s and [Valkyrie]s

Betrayal.name: Tragedy
Betrayal.cinematic: <0> I am Rig, son of the High King Hargurorf, and this is my saga. </0> <1> It all began... one fateful day... </1> <2> My father had gathered all his Jarls to make an announcement of the utmost importance. </2> <3> We were to embark for the wondrous lands of Northgard; riches, conquest and glory awaited us on this mysterious new continent. </3> <4> But the Norns had other plans for us... </4> <5> Dozens of armed men suddenly poured into the Hall and put an abrupt end to our ambitions... and to our lives. </5> <6> They were mercenaries led by a man named Hagen, from the Clan of the Raven. </6> <7> In a matter of minutes, we were all slaughtered like sheep. </7> <8> All… but me. Barely conscious and vastly outnumbered, I had no way to fight back, so I feigned death. </8> <9> I seethed as he stole the map of Northgard and ripped the Regal Horn from my father's throne, a family heirloom and the very symbol of our royalty. </9> <10> I had to avenge my father... and reclaim my kinghood! </10>

Journey.name: Exodus
Journey.desc: We have safely escaped to a remote region. We must now reach the shores of Northgard.
Journey.objectives: <0 id="mShore"> Reach the shore to the north. </0> <1 id="mPort"> Build a [Port]. </1> <2 id="bFood"> Acquire a minimum of ::value:: [Food]. </2> <3 id="bRuin"> Explore all the [BrokenHouse]s. </3> <4 id="bYear"> Build the [Port] before Year ::value::. </4>
Journey.cinematic: <0> I had no strength left when I encountered a group of runaways of the Stag Clan led by a proud young man named Brand. </0> <1> Hagen's men had set his town aflame and he had nothing left, not even his father, the clan's Jarl, who had died at the hands of the fiend just like mine. </1> <2> Our common enemy had sailed for Northgard, of which he now had a map. All I could think about was finding him to avenge my father and retrieve the Regal Horn. </2>
Journey.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Brand"> Glad to see you back on your feet, my lord. I'm surprised at how fast you recovered. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Rig"> I suppose rage is an excellent healer. Still, we've wasted enough time already. We must go after Hagen as soon as possible. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Brand"> Indeed, time is of the essence. Our camp is far from the enemy, but we are marooned in an unknown province on the outskirts of your kingdom. </2> <3 id="start4" who="Rig"> I shall prove myself worthy of their trust. However impatient I am to get even with that scum, my priority is to ensure their survival. </3> <4 id="start5" who="Brand"> Very good. Your restraint does you honor. Besides, none of us will be getting revenge if we starve to death first. </4> <5 id="start6" who="Brand"> Speaking of which, there will be no shortage of mouths to feed, so let us seek out food. Wood is also a vital resource, being used for both heating and construction. </5> <6 id="start7" who="Rig"> We must also leave the continent and set sail for Northgard. We shall need a proper shore to go out to sea. </6> <7 id="start8" who="Brand"> You are quite right. I suggest you instruct villagers to build a scout camp and assign them as scouts, so that they may explore the region. </7> <8 id="winter1" who="Rig"> Hmm, the air is getting colder... winter is almost upon us. </8> <9 id="winter2" who="Brand"> Indeed, my lord. We should expect food to be scarcer, and our people will consume more firewood to heat their homes. </9> <10 id="winter3" who="Rig"> Our military troops will also be weakened by the cold. It might not be the best time to fight. </10> <11 id="house1" who="Brand"> My lord, reconnaissance of the area has revealed an abandoned cottage. </11> <12 id="house2" who="Rig"> Perhaps we should order a scout to search it. They might be able to salvage some resources. </12> <13 id="house3" who="Brand"> Agreed. We will have to colonize the area before they can explore the ruins, however. </13> <14 id="harbor1" who="Brand"> My lord, one scout claims to have found a suitable coast for the construction of a port. </14> <15 id="harbor2" who="Rig"> Excellent. We should colonize the area leading up to this shore so that our builders can reach it and get to work. </15> <16 id="end1" who="Brand"> At last! Thanks to your efforts, our clan can now put out to sea. </16> <17 id="end2" who="Rig"> Anchors aweigh, proud Vikings! We sail for Northgard! </17> <18 id="end3" who="Rig"> Your end draws near, Hagen. </18>
Journey.tutorial: <0 id="title"> Getting Started </0> <1 id="sentence1"> You are in a safe, remote area. Your goal here is to meet the basic survival needs of your clan: [Food], [Wood] and [House]s. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Be sure to assign [Scout]s so that they can explore the region, and then expand your territory by colonizing nearby areas. Find a shore to embark in search of undiscovered lands. </2>

Foothold.name: Foothold
Foothold.desc: Northgard is a harsh continent. We must tame these lands, lest we be forgotten by history.
Foothold.objectives: <0 id="mTerritory"> Colonize ::value:: territories. </0> <1 id="mFame"> Reach ::value:: [Fame]. </1> <2 id="mGoat"> Send your military units to kill all [Wolf]s around Halvard's settlement. </2> <3 id="bHappy"> Reach ::value:: [Happy]. </3> <4 id="bWolf"> Destroy all [WolvesCave]s. </4> <5 id="bTrade"> Trade [Food] and [Wood] with Halvard via 2 Trade Routes for at least ::value:: month(s) each. </5>
Foothold.cinematic: <0> My companions' eyes were shining with ambition; they were eager to set foot on the untamed lands of Northgard and reap its wonders. </0> <1> But my heart was tormented by a darker appetite. </1> <2> Vengeance. </2>
Foothold.texts: <0 id="start0" who="Rig"> Land ho! Finally, we set foot on Northgard! </0> <1 id="start1" who="Brand"> My lord, we have dismantled our longships and used the scrap lumber to build a town hall on the shore. </1> <2 id="start2" who="Rig"> There is no turning back now. Thank you for your dedication. </2> <3 id="start3" who="Brand"> We await your orders to claim the region and expand our clan. </3> <4 id="start4" who="Rig"> There is much to be done. We must colonize the surrounding area to expand our living space and find resources... </4> <5 id="start5" who="Rig"> ...and we need to raise our fame if we hope to stake a rightful claim to the region. </5> <6 id="start6" who="Brand"> Please stay safe and lead us to victory, my lord! </6> <7 id="draugr1" who="Brand"> What is this wretched creature? </7> <8 id="draugr2" who="Rig"> Could that be... a draugr? </8> <9 id="draugr3" who="Rig"> I have heard old men's tales of undead warriors, but I never gave them much credit. Apparently I was wrong. </9> <10 id="draugr4" who="Brand"> At any rate, we should defend our people and slay this fiendish abomination! </10> <11 id="mine1" who="Brand"> We just discovered a mineral deposit. These come in two types: stone and iron ore. </11> <12 id="mine2" who="Brand"> Both are important resources, and both can be extracted by miners. Build a mine and assign villagers to them. </12> <13 id="mine3" who="Brand"> Stone can be used to improve our buildings. Iron allows us to make our tools better, as well as to rearm a bannerman–such as myself–if they should fall in battle. </13> <14 id="mine4" who="Brand"> Keep in mind that a deposit is finite and typically holds little ore. Be sure to make good use of it. </14> <15 id="goatAppear1" who="Brand"> My lord, we have encountered another clan. What shall we do? </15> <16 id="goatAppear2" who="Rig"> Are they with that scum Hagen? </16> <17 id="goatAppear3" who="Halvard"> We come in peace! I am Halvard of Heidrun, the Goat Clan. We mean you no harm! Please offer us assistance! </17> <18 id="goatAppear4" who="Rig"> Greetings, Halvard of Heidrun. I am Rig, son of the late High King Hargurorf. What ails you? </18> <19 id="goatAppear5" who="Halvard"> My deepest condolences, my young lord. We too have lost much of late. </19> <20 id="goatAppear6" who="Halvard"> Our journey went awry and... well, to be brief, we are now shipwrecked on a desolate shore. </20> <21 id="goatAppear7" who="Halvard"> We have nothing left and will soon give in to the wilderness... I beg of you, help us! </21> <22 id="goatAppear8" who="Rig"> We will lend you our aid. What would you have us do? </22> <23 id="goatAppear9" who="Halvard"> Thank you! It should not be too much trouble... </23> <24 id="goatAppear10" who="Halvard"> Your warriors need only exterminate the wolves threatening our fragile camp. </24> <25 id="lore1" who="Brand"> We've acquired enough Lore to develop a new skill. Please choose wisely, for it will have consequences for our expansion... and our survival. </25> <26 id="lore2" who="Brand"> It is crucial that we study any Runestone or Circle of Stones we encounter. It will allow our Loremasters to gather Lore and develop our Knowledge. </26> <27 id="wolfAttack1" who="Halvard"> Young lord! The beasts are upon us! We need assistance! Please send reinforcements at your earliest opportunity! </27> <28 id="endGoat1" who="Brand"> My lord, I am delighted to report that Halvard's camp is now safe from any beastly threat. </28> <29 id="endGoat2" who="Rig"> Excellent. Please make sure his people receive the food they need. And tend to their wounded. </29> <30 id="endGoat3" who="Halvard"> On behalf of the Heidrun Clan, I would like to express our most heartfelt gratitude. We would have been doomed without you. </30> <31 id="endGoat4" who="Halvard"> From now until the end of time, you can count on the help and loyalty of the Goat Clan. I hereby solemnly pledge my allegiance to you. </31> <32 id="endFame" who="Brand"> Glorious! Our Clan has reached a notable level of fame. Our influence over the region is strong, and our people's hearts are filled with pride! </32> <33 id="endTerritory" who="Brand"> Magnificent! Our territory has reached a substantial size. The populace will be able to thrive here after we leave for the next region. </33> <34 id="defeatGoat" who="Halvard"> Woe is us! You won't make it in time... We are doomed. Yet we go to the grave without resentment. May you succeed where we failed! </34>
Foothold.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Eikthyrnir </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Clan of the Stag enjoys extra resources as it develops and thrives. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> They also excel when it comes to [Happy] and [Fame], so take advantage of these assets to expand in peace. </2>

Outpost.name: Settlement
Outpost.desc: Hagen is reported to have settled in the region. We must strengthen our position while trying to find him.
Outpost.objectives: <0 id="mTemple"> Build a [Tavern] and an [Temple]. <1 id="mFame"> Reach ::value:: [Fame]. <2 id="mRaven"> Destroy the Raven Outpost. <3 id="bSheep"> Hold ::value:: [Sheep] in [Sheepfold]s at any one time. <4 id="bValkyrie"> Kill all [Valkyrie]s. <5 id="bFeast"> Organize ::value:: Feasts. <6 id="mWait"> Hold out until reinforcements arrive.
