We ought to work twice as hard! </49> <50 id="winterEnds" who="Rig"> Fimbulvinter is over! </50> <51 id="armyAttack1Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, the remainder of the army is thawing out! </51> <52 id="armyAttack1Goat" who="Halvard"> By Odin's eye... The frozen army is bound to descend on us! </52> <53 id="armyAttack1Wolf" who="Egil"> Ah... It's warmin' up finally... Freaks incoming! Get ready to fight! </53> <54 id="armyAttack1Raven" who="Liv"> The army of the dead is thawing out... </54> <55 id="armyAttack1Boar" who="Svarn"> The dead are... inbound... </55> <56 id="armyAttack1Bear" who="Borgild"> 'Tis warmer, all right! The freaks be incoming! </56> <57 id="armyAttack2" who="Rig"> Brace yourselves for battle! This is the final assault... We will hold our ground... or die trying! </57> <58 id="rightAllyFallsStag" who="Brand"> My lord, the eastern front has fallen! We must prepare for an attack on our right flank! </58> <59 id="rightAllyFallsGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, I fear our friends on the eastern front have fallen! We should brace for an attack from the right! </59> <60 id="rightAllyFallsWolf" who="Egil"> Those guys on the right side didn't make it. Just means more monsters for me to fight! Sweet! </60> <61 id="rightAllyFallsRaven" who="Liv"> Blast, the eastern front has failed to hold their position. Our right side is now exposed. </61> <62 id="rightAllyFallsBoar" who="Svarn"> Our friends on the... eastern front have fallen. We MUST be prepared to deal with their attackers. </62> <63 id="rightAllyFallsBear" who="Borgild"> Och, those weaklings on the eastern side didn't make it! Prepare to be attacked from the right! </63> <64 id="leftAllyFallsStag" who="Brand"> My lord, the western front has fallen! Our left flank is bound to be harried soon! </64> <65 id="leftAllyFallsGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, our friends on the western front did all they could, but they have been overwhelmed. We are bound to be attacked from the left! </65> <66 id="leftAllyFallsWolf" who="Egil"> And there goes the left side! I get their share of the freaks to battle! Nice! </66> <67 id="leftAllyFallsRaven" who="Liv"> Bad news... The western front is no more. Our left side is now vulnerable. </67> <68 id="leftAllyFallsBoar" who="Svarn"> Our allies on the... western front are no more. We must BRACE for an attack from the left. </68> <69 id="leftAllyFallsBear" who="Borgild"> Ye got to be kidding me. The men to the west had ONE job! If they've failed, we'll be attacked from the left soon. </69> <70 id="end1" who="Rig"> Phew, that was not an easy battle. Salvage whatever is left and heal the wounded. </70> <71 id="end2" who="Brand"> Lo! The wall of ice is melting! </71> <72 id="end3" who="Egil"> It's about time! Let's get out of here before I cool down. </72> <73 id="end4" who="Liv"> At last! I just hope what lies beyond is not even colder. </73> <74 id="end5" who="Borgild"> Even I am fed up with all that snow. Think I've got rime in me boots. </74> <75 id="end6" who="Halvard"> I fear the worst is yet to come. </75> <76 id="end7" who="Svarn"> Indeed... Beyond Bergelmir's Throat is Bifröst... and Hvedrung. We must STOP this madman. </76> <77 id="end8" who="Rig"> We must carry on. Whatever is next will be the end of our quest. We are nearing the northern borders of Northgard. </77> <78 id="end10" who="Rig"> Let us march on! TO BIFROST! </78> <79 id="end9" who="Rig"> I can only promise you more blood and tears. But our fate, and that of Northgard–perhaps all of humanity–will soon be sealed. </79>
Frozen.tutorial: <0 id="title"> Fimbulvinter </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Great Winter will last several years. Wait for spring to melt the great ice wall. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Brace yourself for when the army of the dead will thaw out. Protect your allies, for you are stronger together! </2>

Bifrost.name: Bifröst
Bifrost.desc: Bifröst, the legendary bridge leading to Asgard, sits in this region. Hvedrung is already there, and we are on the brink of Ragnarök. We must stop him at all costs!
Bifrost.objectives: <0 id="mBifrost"> Protect [Bifrost] at all costs. </0> <1 id="mHvedrung"> Slay Hvedrung. </1> <2 id="bPortal"> Seal one [Muspell] each year. </2> <3 id="bKobold"> Annihilate all the poor [Kobold]s. </3> <4 id="bBifrost"> Do not let [Bifrost] fall below 50% durability. </4>
Bifrost.cinematic: <0> At last we were reaching our goal. The land where Bifrost had been concealed for eons was... peaceful. Heavenly, even. </0> <1> But as we marched forward, a great indescribable sound shook earth and sky alike. It still echoes through my mind. </1> <2> This was, of course, Gjallarhorn's wail, and the beginning of Ragnarök. </2> <3> Hvedrung was ahead of us, ready to set the sons of Muspell loose on Northgard. </3> <4> Everything we had done to get here, every life sacrificed, would have been in vain if we failed to stop the tyrant from destroying the legendary bridge. </4>
Bifrost.texts: <0 id="start0" who="Rig"> Bifröst, at last! </0> <1 id="start1" who="Rig"> What a dreadful sound! </1> <2 id="start2" who="Svarn"> Hvedrung has blown Gjallarhorn... Thus, we are on the brink of Ragnarök. The sons of Muspell shall be here soon. </2> <3 id="start3" who="Rig"> Hvedrung, stop this folly at once! </3> <4 id="start4" who="Hvedrung"> I salute your determination, young king. But you are too late: with Gjallarhorn, I will open the gates of Muspelheim. </4> <5 id="start5" who="Hvedrung"> This world shall soon be engulfed in flames... but believe me, 'tis no folly. </5> <6 id="start6" who="Rig"> But why...? What have you to gain from all this? And how did the Runestone of Asgard foretell your baleful deeds? Who ARE you? </6> <7 id="start7" who="Hvedrung"> Who I am is unimportant, as were your father and your pathetic quest for revenge. All that matters is what will be gained from destroying Bifröst. </7> <8 id="start8" who="Rig"> You are a madman! What do you want? To slay the gods? To become the absolute ruler of Asgard? </8> <9 id="start9" who="Hvedrung"> I do not seek to rule over gods or men. I wish to set Midgard and Asgard asunder, to set men free from Odin's will. </9> <10 id="start10" who="Rig"> That is nonsense! What would humans have to gain from losing the All-Father? What good would a world of ashes be to us? </10> <11 id="start11" who="Hvedrung"> Odin lives in perpetual dread of Ragnarök, for he knows he shall meet his fate. He has been training our brethren in Valhöll in hopes of preventing his inevitable demise. </11> <12 id="start12" who="Hvedrung"> He has no love for humans. To him they are mere puppets, whom he has been stringing along with empty promises of eternal glory since the dawn of time. </12> <13 id="start13" who="Svarn"> Do not listen to him, my lord... Hvedrung is a heretic. His words have poisoned many of my brothers' souls... </13> <14 id="start14" who="Svarn"> There is no... reasoning with him. The very existence of my... rebellion proves he will only respond to... force. </14> <15 id="start15" who="Hvedrung"> You are wiser than I am, Svarn. You always have been. But your faith is misguided. Fight the inevitable if you so desire. </15> <16 id="start16" who="Hvedrung"> Now, let Ragnarök... COMMENCE! </16> <17 id="start17" who="DefaultBannerman"> Fire giants incoming! </17> <18 id="start18Goat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, the final battle is nigh! You can count on us and the settlements we built all over Northgard to send you support! </18> <19 id="start18Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, the final battle is nigh! You can count on us and the settlements we built all over Northgard to send you support! </19> <20 id="muspellGate1" who="Rig"> Bifröst is under attack too! We must send troops to defend it! </20> <21 id="muspellGate2" who="DefaultBannerman"> Huh? The fire giants died suddenly! What is happening? </21> <22 id="muspellGate3" who="Rig"> It seems the Eldthursar are unable to sustain their presence far from the flames of Muspelheim. This will work in our favor, but we cannot leave Bifröst unattended. </22> <23 id="muspellGate4" who="Rig"> We must hie to any gate we can find, and then seal them! </23> <24 id="vedrfolnir1" who="DefaultBannerman"> Is that... Vedrfolnir? </24> <25 id="vedrfolnir2" who="Rig"> Its senses must have been disrupted by Gjallarhorn. The poor thing has crashed to the ground. </25> <26 id="start22old" who="Rig"> I know I am asking much of you all. Everything we have done–every life taken, every life lost–has led us to this point. </26> <27 id="start23old" who="Rig"> We must protect Bifröst at all costs! We cannot allow Ragnarök to happen! Hvedrung dies this day! </27> <28 id="helpReceivedStag" who="Brand"> My lord, we have just received a shipment of supplies and reinforcements from our Northgard allies. </28> <29 id="helpReceivedGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, we have received help and supplies from our Northgardian fellows! </29> <30 id="helpReceivedWolf" who="Egil"> Hey, Rig, we just got more guys and supplies from all over Northgard! </30> <31 id="helpReceivedRaven" who="Liv"> I've been informed that our settlements all across Northgard have sent help and supplies. </31> <32 id="helpReceivedBoar" who="Svarn"> Our Northgardian... brethren have sent us men and a shipment of supplies! </32> <33 id="helpReceivedBear" who="Borgild"> Hey, hornless king, we just received blokes and a bunch of supplies from the rest of Northgard! </33> <34 id="end1" who="Rig"> At long last! I have finally cornered you. </34> <35 id="end2" who="Hvedrung"> ... </35> <36 id="end3" who="Svarn"> Hvedrung, you have... lost. Ragnarök has not... come to pass. Everything you did was in vain. </36> <37 id="end4" who="Egil"> He's yours! Kill this rascal! </37> <38 id="end5" who="Borgild"> Look, the coward surrenders! Kill him anyway! </38> <39 id="end6" who="Brand"> What do you have to say for yourself, fiend? </39> <40 id="end7" who="Hvedrung"> ... </40> <41 id="end8" who="Halvard"> So much suffering... and for what? </41> <42 id="end9" who="Liv"> Well, clearly he has nothing to say in his own defense. </42> <43 id="end10" who="Brand"> Your revenge is at hand, my lord. </43> <44 id="end11" who="Rig"> You must be truly mad. Faced with your own demise, you dare laugh at my face? I will put you out of your misery. </44> <45 id="end12" who="Hvedrung"> You are victorious, high king... </45> <46 id="end13" who="Hvedrung"> ... But you still arrived too late. </46> <47 id="defeat1" who="Hvedrung"> Finally... the sons of Muspell have destroyed Bifröst... </47> <48 id="defeat2" who="Hvedrung"> Odin, prepare to meet your fate! </48> <49 id="Horn1" who="Hvedrung"> [Vuvuzela] </49> <50 id="allGatesSealed1" who="Rig"> There, all the gates have been sealed. We can call back the other bannermen, as we no longer need them as backup. </50> <51 id="allGatesSealed2" who="DefaultBannerman"> Understood. </51>
Bifrost.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Sons of Muspell </0> <1 id="sentence1"> Fire giants will pour from the gates of Muspell. Fend them off while trying to seal as many gates as possible to reduce their inflow. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Protect Bifröst at all costs, survive the assault by Hvedrung's lieutenants, and put an end to his folly when the time comes! </2>

GameEnding.name: Ragnarök
GameEnding.cinematic: <0> Hvedrung was finally in my grasp. He had failed and we were the victors. Or so I thought. </0> <1> Just as I was about to end his miserable life, Hvedrung smiled peacefully, betraying no hint of regret or bitterness. </1> <2> "You are victorious, High King," he said, "but you still arrived too late. Bifrost may still stand, yet the World Tree has been shaken to its roots. You think you prevented Ragnarök; I say we are in the midst of it." </2> <3> He went on: "My work here is done; the men may not yet be free from Odin's yoke, but they now know that defiance is an option. This is the dawn of a new era. Do what you will with me, spare me or kill me; it matters not." </3> <4> Why those words pierced my soul, I shall never know. I suddenly lost all will to kill him, realizing how futile it would be. It would never bring my father back, and he was right; Ragnarök WAS happening. </4> <5> Or rather... it IS happening. This is a new era indeed. Our story is not over; it is only beginning. Northgard needs to heal, and we will be here to tend to its wounds. </5> <6> So, this continent we once called untamed and hostile... We shall now call it… </6> <7> Home. </7>

Maelstrom.name: Dying World (Maelstrom)
Maelstrom.objectives: <0 id="m0"> Colonize the Portal to Yggdrazil and keep controle during one year </0> <1 id="b0"> Kill at least 20 Valkyries </1> <2 id="b1"> Reach 10 happiness and keep that during one year </2> <3 id="b2"> Reach Portal before year 4 </3>
Maelstrom.cinematic: <0> At last we were reaching our goal. But as we marched forward, a great indescribable sound shook earth and sky alike. It still echoes through my mind. </0> <1> This was, of course, Gjallarhorn's wail, and the beginning of Ragnarök. It had opened the portal to Bifrost, and in so doing had upset the world itself. </1> <2> Hurrying across a Northgard that was more wretched than ever, we made our way to the portal to thwart Hvedrung's baleful plans. </2>

Debug.name: Debug
Debug.objectives: <0 id="m0"> Test objectif 1 </0> <1 id="m1"> Test objectif 2 : ::value:: </1>

BannerStag.desc: Proud and noble at heart, the bannerman of the Stag Clan is a loyal man who lives and fights with honor. Nothing matters more to him than his people's wellbeing. He is faithful to you, as his father was to yours, and is willing to help you exact your revenge... and conquer Northgard!

BannerGoat.desc: The elderly bannerman of the Goat Clan is a wise and kind-hearted man focused on the survival of his people. He abhors senseless violence, but still packs quite a punch when provoked. He and the Heidrun Clan pledged allegiance to you after you saved them from ravenous wolves.

BannerWolf.desc: A ruthless and impetuous young berserker, the bannerman of the Wolf Clan is mostly in it for the mayhem. Brand had little trouble rallying him to your cause: a quest for vengeance and the prospect of glorious battle were enough to get him excited.

BannerRaven.desc: Ambitious and pragmatic, the cunning bannermaiden of the Raven Clan likes to control every parameter of a situation and hates wasting time or Kröwns on futile pursuits. Seeing that the tide was turning, she didn't hesitate to kill Hagen, her mentor, to prove her loyalty to you.

BannerBoar.desc: The taciturn spiritual leader of the Boar Clan rebels is a sage and warrior who lives a simple life, close to nature and in accordance with the Old Ways. His uprising against Hvedrung was close to being crushed when you intervened. He is more than willing to help you, since you have a common nemesis.

BannerBear.desc: Brave and arrogant, the bannermaiden of the Bear Clan is a tough woman who bows to no one and shows little mercy for the weakhearted. She refused to recognize you as the rightful king since you lost the Regal Horn, and so she challenged you to a contest, from which you emerged victorious. She had no choice but to grudgingly pledge her allegiance.

Purify.desc: Sacrifice your [NornArmor] to immediately colonize a neutral or enemy zone.

Taunt.name: Provocation
Taunt.desc: Provoke non neutral enemies and [WatchTower]s around [OxHero] and increase his defense.

Dash.name: Ram
Dash.desc: [OxHero] dashes toward a selected building and destroys it

Cleanse.name: Cleanse
Cleanse.desc: Your units in the territory instantly recover from all states of Hunger, Sickness, Freezing and Unhappiness and receives a ::value0:: seconds immunity from them.

SharpEye.name: Sharp Eye
SharpEye.desc: [LynxBrown] and [LynxWhite] can reveal undiscovered zones. You need to upgrade the [ScoutCamp] to reveal an enemy area.

SacredLure.name: Mythical Lure
SacredLure.desc:
Places a lure that baits aggressive mythical animals in the zone. They will come in increasingly stronger waves.
Hunting them is a good source of [HuntTrophy]s and helps your population growth.

SummonWildHunt.name: Oskoreia
SummonWildHunt.desc:
Sacrifices your [LynxHero] to call the strongest wave of Mythical Animals you killed in their temporary spirit form, to assist you on the battlefield.
::composition::
Their presence increases your [Happy] by ::value2::.
Hiring [LynxHero] won't cost anything after her sacrifice.

WarEffort.name: War Effort
WarEffort.desc: You can choose a free military Lore.

WarriorCharge.name: Charge
WarriorCharge.desc: Increases run speed when the engaged target is close enough.

SkirmisherPoison.name: Poison
SkirmisherPoison.desc: Decreases target's attack speed and move speed by ::inv_percent0:: for ::value1:: seconds.

SwirlAttack.name: Whirlwind
SwirlAttack.desc: [Dragonmen]s sometimes execute a mighty swirling strike that damages all surrounding enemies.

LeatherArmor.name: Reinforced Armor
LeatherArmor.desc: Military units have a ::percent_value:: chance of negating incoming attacks.

SuppressingFireMilitary.name: Suppressing Fire
SuppressingFireMilitary.desc: Human units within an area that contains an allied [WatchTower] gain +::percent_value:: defense.

SuppressingFireTower.name: Suppressing Fire
SuppressingFireTower.desc: You gain a free [WatchTower] upgrade each year.

Garrison.name: Garrison
Garrison.desc: Each [WatchTower] adds +::value0:: to your maximum warband (+::value1:: if upgraded).

CallToArms.name: Call To Arms
CallToArms.desc:
Call to Arms is a passive ability placed on you Town Hall. Every six months, homeland sends you up to ::value1:: [Militia]s to help you defend your territory.
[Militia] is a self-sufficient unit that patrols within your territory and attack any threat coming in.
You can have a maximum of ::nb:: [Militia] in your territory.

CallToArmsXP.name: Call To Arms
CallToArmsXP.desc: Each kill on allied territory gives +::percent_value0:: [MilitaryXP].

CallToArmsII.name: Call To Arms II
CallToArmsII.desc: You can keep up to ::value:: [Militia] in your territory.

CallToArmsIII.name: Call To Arms III
CallToArmsIII.desc: You can keep up to ::value:: [Militia] in your territory.

BloodBath.name: Blood Bath
BloodBath.desc: Each time one of your units dies in enemy territory, friendly units in the area gain +::percent_value0:: attack and +::percent_value1:: defense for ::value2:: month. The bonus is lost when units exit the area.

VeteranWarSkirmisher.name: Veteran Fighters
VeteranWarSkirmisher.desc: [Skirmisher]s: increase the decolonization speed by ::percent_value:: each.

VeteranWarDragonmen.name: Veteran Fighters
VeteranWarDragonmen.desc: [Dragonmen]s: whenever they kill a unit, you gain some [Blood] depending on the unit max life.

SacrificeAtk.name: Magni's Influence
SacrificeAtk.desc: +::percent_value:: attack power for non-thralls human units.

CanHide.name: Cloaked
CanHide.desc: Can hide from foes, unless war is declared in the zone.

GiantCrowAoE.name: Bash
GiantCrowAoE.desc: They sometimes attack with their two huge warhammers, damaging all nearby enemies.

OxHeroAoE.name: Stomp
OxHeroAoE.desc: Sometimes used instead of the usual attack, damaging all nearby enemies.

FrozenStrike.name: Frozen Strike
FrozenStrike.desc: Enemies hit by Valdemar are frozen, along with the area around them. (::value2:: penalty on move and attack speed).

KingsBodyguard.name: King's Bodyguard
KingsBodyguard.desc: [LichKing] cannot take damages as long as he is close to an [IceGolem].

Stealth.name: Stealth
Stealth.desc: Enemy [WatchTower]s won't attack stealthed units for ::value:: seconds.

DamageReturn.name: Reflection
DamageReturn.desc: Enemy attacking this unit will receive ::percent_value:: of their own damages back.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.desc: This unit is hidden and can only be seen by other units in the same zone.

SwampPoison.name: Rot
SwampPoison.desc: Units are slowed down and take damage over time.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.desc: They can use [Camouflage] to hide from foes.
Camouflage.texts: <0> Can hide from foes, unless war is declared in the zone. </0>

ClawStrike.name: Claw Strike
ClawStrike.desc: [LynxBrown]'s first attack is a powerful slash that temporarily lowers the enemy's defenses.

Cicatrization.name: Cicatrization
Cicatrization.desc: [LynxHero] slowly heals her Lynxes when in the same zone and out of combat.

FeralInstinct.name: Feral Instinct
FeralInstinct.desc: [Tracker]s that participated in a mythical animal kill permanently gain +::percent_value:: attack (max +::percent_value1::). Lost on death.

PathComplete.name: Path Complete
PathComplete.desc: All [Tracker]s gain +::percent_value:: attack speed, +::percent_value1:: range distance and +::percent_value2:: move speed each time this ability is bought.

CompanionshipBrown.name: Companionship
CompanionshipBrown.desc: He has +::percent:: attack power while in the same zone as [LynxWhite].
CompanionshipBrown.texts: <0> [LynxBrown] has +::percent:: attack power while in the same zone as [LynxWhite]. </0>

CompanionshipWhite.name: Companionship
CompanionshipWhite.desc: He has +::percent:: defense while in the same zone as [LynxBrown].
CompanionshipWhite.texts: <0> [LynxWhite] has +::percent:: defense while in the same zone as [LynxBrown]. </0>

Ablaze.name: Ablaze
Ablaze.desc: This building is burning uncontrollably. You may need to repair the building to stop the fire!

WildHuntDecay.name: Oskoreia Spirit
WildHuntDecay.desc: Spirits called upon for the wild hunt cannot hold a physical form for too long. They lose health over time and can't be healed.

FerociousBite.name: Ferocious Bite
FerociousBite.desc: Every third attack is a ferocious bite that deals +::percent:: damage.

BearStompAoE.name: Stomp
BearStompAoE.desc: Every third attack is a trembling stomp that damages all nearby enemies.

BoneArrows.name: Bone Arrows
BoneArrows.desc: Your [Tracker]s fire bone arrows. They are the ammunition by default and don't cost any wood.

HinderingArrows.name: Hindering Arrows
HinderingArrows.desc: Your [Tracker]s fire hindering arrows, slowing targets hit.
HinderingArrows.texts: <0> Using them in combat costs wood. </0>

MultiArrows.name: Double Shot
MultiArrows.desc: Your [Tracker]s can shoot ::value1:: additional arrow at enemies close to their primary target. Secondary targets take ::percent_value3:: damage.
MultiArrows.texts: <0> Using them in combat costs wood. </0>

FireArrows.name: Fire Arrows
FireArrows.desc: Your [Tracker]s use fire arrows that inflict +::percent1:: damage to buildings.
FireArrows.texts: <0> Using them in combat costs wood. </0>

HammerThunder.name: Lightning Storm
HammerThunder.desc: Sends a thunderstorm on a zone, damaging all units and buildings over one month.

Annexation.name: Annexation
Annexation.desc: Colonize an enemy zone for free just after decolonizing it.

GiantRaid.name: Raid of the [GiantCrow]
GiantRaid.desc: Sends a raid a on coastal zone with 2 [GiantCrow]s.

CallGiantBoar.name: Call of Gullinbursti
CallGiantBoar.desc: Summons a non controllable [GiantBoar] in all forests.

FrozenEarth.name: Chilling Aura
FrozenEarth.desc: Enemies hit by Gram are frozen, along with the area around them. (::value2:: penalty on move and attack speed).

MoveRelic.name: Move Relic
MoveRelic.desc: Move the Shield to another zone in your territory, only if the two zones are undisputed.

SpikeTrap.name: Spike Trap
SpikeTrap.desc: Deploys hidden spikes on a zone frontiers. Nothing can enter nor exit it for ::value1:: seconds.

Stilt.name: Shallow Waters
Stilt.desc: Improve a coastal zone to accept one additional building.

HighTide.name: High Tide
HighTide.desc:
Cancel the Kraken's building and attack penalties in a non-coastal zone.
You can colonize a neutral non-coastal zone for the normal cost.
You can only cast [HighTide] on a non-coastal zone adjacent to coastal zones or zones affected by [HighTide]

RoadToValhalla.name: Road To Valhalla
RoadToValhalla.desc: Consecrate one of your [Norn]. She becomes a [NornArmor] and joins your army.

AncientSpirit.name: Ancient Spirit
AncientSpirit.desc: Summon ::value:: hostile [SpecterWarrior]s to a chosen enemy coastal zone.

Escape.name: DEPRECATED
Escape.desc: Runs to the border of the nearest safe zone upon getting hit.

CallBlood.name: Call of Blood
CallBlood.description: Other clans are thirsty for your blood. Survive and send them to Valhala.

InnerSea.name: Inner Sea
InnerSea.description: Get around the inner sea and defeat all your opponents one by one.

Cursed.name: The Cursed
Cursed.description: Valdemar summons new draugar from the dead. Team up with other clans to defeat his icy bodyguards and slay him.

VikingsGlory.name: Viking's Glory
VikingsGlory.description: Only the clans with the most fame will claim the rewards.

NewSettlers.name: New Settlers
NewSettlers.description: You'll have plenty of villagers; and all the problems that come with them.

LazyVillagers.name: Lazy Villagers
LazyVillagers.description: Villagers will not gather food. Try to assign them to buildings instead.

RaceYggdrasil.name: Race to Yggdrasil
RaceYggdrasil.description: To claim Yggdrasil, you must gather a lot of food. But don't forget that you have to store it.

SwampsDeath.name: Swamps of Death
SwampsDeath.description: You don't have much room for building. Choose wisely or expand more than usual.

Invasion.name: Invasion from Helheim
Invasion.description: You are alone to deal with the gates to Helheim. Expand and maintain the pressure before the end of times.

MarketSupplier.name: Master Supplier
MarketSupplier.description: Marketplaces are cheap and efficient, building a lot of them could be a good idea.

BeyondSea.name: Beyond the Sea
BeyondSea.description: Victory isn't on the mainland. Build docks and be the best merchant in the known world.

ImportedKnowledge.name: Imported Knowledge
ImportedKnowledge.description: Make money and purchase knowledge with the power of currency.

WinterHere.name: Winter Is Here
WinterHere.description: Is it really possible to handle a terrible blizzard each winter? You will know the answer soon.

Oppressed.name: Defend The Oppressed
Oppressed.description: Destroy your enemies while defending your weaker ally.

Surrounded.name: Surrounded
Surrounded.description: What if all your enemies are around you? Don't let them expand too much!

SaveBifrost.name: Bifrost
SaveBifrost.description: Rush to colonize [BifrostLore] and protect it from other clans!

KeepSimple.name: Keep It simple
KeepSimple.description: No civilian building upgrade or tool improvement. You'll have to do a lot with very little.

WiseOne.name: The Wise One
WiseOne.description: Claim the [BigSword] and accumulate Lore to reach victory.

GreedPrice.name: Greed's Price
GreedPrice.description: Explore the land to find the resources you cannot produce.

Dystopia.name: Dystopia
Dystopia.description: Being always happy is good news. Deal with the [SpecterWarrior] to maintain your happiness.

HostileLands.name: Hostile Lands
HostileLands.description: Don't be too slow to expand. Skirmisher are powerful and can bring an easy victory.

Frozen.name: Frozen Gates
Frozen.description: Survive long enough and hope the frozen horde destroy your enemies. Between two frozen attacks, feel free to kill them yourself, if you can.

MuspellWrath.name: Muspell's Wrath
MuspellWrath.description: Kill more [GiantFire]s than your opponents. Take no breaks; your opponents are as bloodthirsty as you!

Wyverns.name: Too Many Wyverns
Wyverns.description: Wyverns, zombie wyverns, enormous wyvern, ... Let's go to town!

ValkyrieGalore.name: Valkyrie Galore
ValkyrieGalore.description: If you can't control Helheim enough, just don't let your enemies do it.

GemCutter.name: Gem Cutter
GemCutter.description: Selling gemstones is the best way to make money.

OdinsGlory.name: For Odin's Glory
OdinsGlory.description: Expand quickly to get to the many iron deposits before your enemies.

BefriendJotnar.name: Befriend the Jotnar
BefriendJotnar.description: Defend the Jotnär despite their aggressive tendancies, then befriend them.

KoboldInfestation.name: Kobold Infestation
KoboldInfestation.description: You must control many territories to win. But Kobolds will expand quickly...

MyrkalfarUprising.name: Myrkalfar Uprising
MyrkalfarUprising.description: Ragnarok is rough, Myrkalfar are aggressive, eruptions are frequent. Just basic survival will be a challenge.

ZombieDraugr.desc: Every viking that dies has a chance to become a neutral [Death].

MoreDraugar.desc: [Death]s respawn quicker from [DeathCamp] and appear more frequently from portals.

NoWalls.desc: No natural walls, all zones are connected.

ForceBigSword.desc: [BigSword] is at the center of the land, already discovered.

ForceHelheim.desc: [Helheim] is at the center of the land, already discovered.

ForceVolcano.desc: [Volcano] is at the center of the land, already discovered.

ForceMagmaFlow.desc: [MagmaFlow] is at the center of the land, already discovered.

ManyLore.desc: There are more [CircleStone]s and [RuneStone]s than usual.

PillarOfGod.desc: You can find a few [PillarOfGod]s. You can assign [Scholar]s to them who will produce [Fame].

BoatResourceFame.desc: Each new year, the player with the highest [Fame] gains resources that will arrive by boat.

Eruptions.desc: Starting at year 802, volcanic eruptions happen each year.

AggressiveMyrkalfar.desc: There are many aggressive [Myrkalfar] camps. Beware of their frequent and early attacks.

ManyKobolds.desc: There are many [KoboldHouse]s. [Kobold]s are more aggressive, and they respawn and expand more quickly.

MoreValkyries.desc: There are [Valkyrie]s on many zones. They are more aggressive.

ManyFactions.desc: All neutral factions are present. There is less hostility in each zone.

WithGemstone.desc: You can find [GemstoneDeposit]s, that produce [Gemstone] which can be sold for a lot of [Money].

HappinessGemstone.desc: Gathering or trading [Gemstone] increases [Happy]. Failing to do so decreases [Happy].

StartCenter.desc: You start at the center of the land.

InnerSea.desc: The center of the land is full of water.

FrozenZombies.desc: Waves of frozen zombified foes come from [Niflheim]s to attack the clans each winter.

FrozenGate.desc: Many [Niflheim]s are opened in the land.

BifrostNoLore.desc: As soon as [BifrostLore] is colonized, the [Lore] you earn is used to activate it.

BasicUpgrade.desc: Can't upgrade buildings or forge tools.

SuperScout.desc: [Scout]s can scout enemy territory without an upgraded [ScoutCamp].

MushroomsHappy.desc: [Happy] is always at ::value::. Any [SpecterWarrior] will ruin your day.

Elevation.desc: A curse will regularly occur, turning some of your population into [SpecterWarrior].

DeathSwamp.desc: All zones have reduced available room for buildings.

MoreFoodSource.desc: There are more [Shoal], [Fertility] and [DeerSpawner] than usual.

Biggdrasil.desc: [Yggdrasil] is larger and costs twice the price to colonize, but it takes only 1 month.

BetterCauldron.desc: The [RelicCauldron] relic costs no [Iron], takes half the time to forge and doesn't count as a built relic.

HeavyPrestige.desc: Incremental rewards for Commercial Influence happens more frequently.

SkirmisherRuthless.desc: [Skirmisher]s have [SkirmisherRuthless] ability, they are more effective versus animals and mystical creatures.

ManyTreasure.desc: There are more lost treasures than usual.

MuspellInvasion.desc: [Muspell]s are opened everywhere, pouring out [GiantFire]s regularly. No one can close them.

BlessJotnar.desc: A large [GiantCamp] has been spotted on this land.

HelheimInvasion.desc: Control and keep all [Helheim]s before time ends.

ManyWyverns.desc: Lots of [Wyvern]s are spotted. It's time for the hunt!

NoResourceLore.desc: There is no [Lore]. All buildings producing [Lore] are disabled. You can't gain [Lore].

PurchaseTechWithKrowns.desc: All knowledge can be purchased with [Money]. Knowledge is more expensive.

IsWeakIA.desc: You must defend your weak ally against the other clans.

BloodMoonReinforcement.desc: You will receive military units before each new [BloodMoon].

LethalRuins.desc: Your [Scout]s die when they finish looting treasures.

MoreReqHappyFoodConsumption.desc: Your population needs more happiness and to eat more food.

BWarchief.desc: -::inv_percent:: cost and revive cooldown for your Warchief

BWarchiefVsUndead.desc: Your warchief has +::percent:: attack power against [Valkyrie]s and [Death]s

BFreeWeapon.desc: {Unit}s weapon costs no resources and forge time is divided by ::value::.

BSilo.desc: [FoodSilo]s store +::percent:: and bonus is increased by ::percent1::

BFreeTool.desc: {Unit}s tools costs no resources and forge time is divided by ::value::.

BMoreSheeps.desc: Each year, you gain ::value:: [Sheep]s for every ::value1:: you own

BForgeRelics.desc: Relics forge time and price is reduced by ::inv_percent::

BSiloImproved.desc: [FoodSilo]s are free, use no building slot and improve [Food] gathering from [Villager]s

BBarricades.desc: You start with the [Barricades] Knowledge. +::percent:: on [Barricades] bonuses.

BFoodAnimals.desc: [Meat] provided by animals such as [Wolf]s, [Bear]s and Lynxes is increased by ::percent::

BBerserkerBetter.desc: Your [Berserker] gains +::percent:: attack power and defense and his recruitment cost is reduced by ::inv_percent1::

BMilitaryHappy.desc: [Happy] provided by your military units is increased by ::percent::

BKaija.desc: Start with [BearMaiden], bonus of +::percent:: attack power and defense.

BMender.desc: +::percent:: for [Mender]s production. [Mender]s tool costs no resources and forge time is divided by 2.

BAltar.desc: [Temple] costs ::percent:: and gains +::percent1:: to all bonuses

BBuildingUpgrade.desc: When you upgrade your [Townhall], you gain ::value:: free building upgrades

BSigny.desc: [WarchiefSnake] gets +::percent:: attack power and defense, and +::health1:: health

BSlaves.desc: Boats bring +::value:: [slave]s, you can own +::percent1:: [Slave]s max. [Slave]s can't revolt.

BWarchiefRegen.desc: Your warchiefs regenerate in your territory.

BWarchiefProd.desc: +::percent:: bonus production in zones with a warchief

BGreatTower.desc: Whenever a [BFTower] is destroyed, it kills all units in the zone

BCoastalHurt.desc: Enemy units in your coastal territory lose life over time

BRecycling.desc: Destroying your buildings earns you back their building cost. Likewise destroying enemy ones using [Dash].

BOxShadow.desc: [OxHero] can summon his own shadow to follow him everywhere.

BCheaperArrows.desc: Reduces arrows' [Wood] consumption in combat by ::percent::.

BWarLures.desc: Allied military units in a trapped zone or near a lure receive +::percent:: attack power and +::percent:: defense.

BWilderHunt.desc: [WildHunt] calls the last ::value:: waves of mythical animals killed.

WeaponDef.name: Tyr's Combat Gloves
WeaponDef.desc: Increases attack power by ::percent::. Reduces projectile damage by ::inv_percent1::.

ArmorDef.name: Tyr's Chain Pauldron
ArmorDef.desc: Increases defense by ::percent:: and health by ::health1::.

LeggingDef.name: Tyr's Charge Leggings
LeggingDef.desc: Adds a ::percent_value:: chance to evade attacks and increases move speed by ::percent1:: in allied territory.

WeaponAtk.name: Heimdall's Sparring Gloves
WeaponAtk.desc: Increases attack by ::percent:: and attack speed by ::percent1::.

ArmorAtk.name: Heimdall's Hunting Pauldron
ArmorAtk.desc: Increases your defense by ::percent::. Reflects ::percent_value1:: of the received attacks.

LeggingAtk.name: Heimdall's Traveler Leggings
LeggingAtk.desc: Unlock the [OxHeroAoE] passive ability, which allows area of effect attacks. Increase move speed by 20% in neutral or enemy territory.

VMilitary.name: Domination
VMilitary.desc: Destroy other players' <font color="#R">Town Halls</font> and become the master of Northgard.

VLore.name: Wisdom
VLore.desc: Discover ancient knowledge and become the <font color="#R">wisest Clan leader</font> in Northgard.

VMoney.name: Trade
VMoney.desc: Amass riches to become the <font color="#R"> greatest merchant</font> in Northgard.

VFame.name: Fame
VFame.desc: Gain enough [Territory] and raise your [Fame] to obtain the title of <font color="#R">King</font>.
VFame.conds: <0> ::value:: areas controlled </0> <2> ::value:: Fame gained </2> <3> Build an [::id::] </3>

VYggdrasil.name: Yggdrasil
VYggdrasil.desc: Find the legendary World Tree, <font color="#R">Yggdrasil</font>, and be the first to conquer it.
VYggdrasil.conds: <0> Discover Yggdrasil </0> <1> Take control of Yggdrasil </1>

VHelheim.name: Helheim
VHelheim.desc: Take control of the <font color="#R">Gate of Helheim</font> and defend the area against the [Valkyrie]s.
VHelheim.conds: <0> Discover Helheim </0> <1> Take control of Helheim </1> <2> Controlled for ::value:: months </2>

VOdinSword.name: Sword of Odin
VOdinSword.desc: Colonize the Anvil of Gods and forge Odin's legendary sword using [Iron].
VOdinSword.conds: <0> Colonize the Anvil of Gods </0> <1> ::value:: sword parts forged </1>

VFameAlt.name: Fame
VFameAlt.desc: Raise your [Fame] to obtain the title of <font color="#R">King</font>.

VHelheimControl.name: Helheim Invasion
VHelheimControl.desc: Control all [Helheim]s to block the invasion.
VHelheimControl.conds: <0> Control an additional gate each year after 801. </0> <1> ::value:: [Helheim] under your control. </1>

VBestFame.name: Glory
VBestFame.desc: Be the most famous when reaching ::date::.

VLoreSword.name: Gods' Wisdom
VLoreSword.desc: Become the wisest warchief. Achieve an Epic Lore Victory by deserving the 4 knowledge blessings and controlling the [BigSword].

VDefendJotnar.name: [Giant]'s Friend
VDefendJotnar.conds: <0> Jötnar must not be defeated </0> <1> ::value:: friendship </1>

VDefendAIAlly.name: Protect the meek
VDefendAIAlly.desc: Protect your weak ally from enemies at any price.

VKillColossalBoar.name: Epic Trophy
VKillColossalBoar.desc: Be the first to find and kill the [ColossalBoar].
